title: Solidity 课程 10: 继承
Mission — Covenant with Kusama
body:
We **shared a form** with you and as a result of this form, Kusama was the winner. As the Nascency team, we are happy to **engage with Kusama**. In this post, we will be sharing **the voting details** and the **contract address** of the Mission Nascency.


---

### The Results of Selection

![I. Kusama | II. Solana | III. Ethereum & Avalanche | IV. Polkadot](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/psn7ZKl5E32MqUvAsd7r6.jpg?height=1000&width=2000)

We **shared a public voting form** 3 days ago and asked you to choose a coin as a reflection reward. The voting results were **Kusama**, which was chosen as seen in the image above. Solana is in second place. Ethereum and Avalanche share third place. Frax Share, on the other hand, did not receive any votes.

> Although we have not finalized it yet, the top 4 coins in this voting may be included in the staking pools that we will share in the future.


---

## Kusama reflected $BIRTH

### Mission Nascency — Kusama

After voting, the address **$BIRTH contract was created**. Adjustments made, tested, and token ready. We can't say for sure about the launch date and time yet, but we strongly encourage you to take your place ready now. 

> **The Nascency Contract Adress:** [0x00361fFcEe7fE1ebe740D9f7BEcBa9C602eB6320](https://bscscan.com/token/0x00361fFcEe7fE1ebe740D9f7BEcBa9C602eB6320)


---

Reflection rewards are **set to Kusama**. 15% of each transaction (buy/sell) will be **automatically distributed** to the holders as a reflection reward (KSM).

We would like to make similar agreements with other projects in the **near future**. The strength of our **community reflects us, and we reflect the project**.

> We keep moving forward, **Swan Pit is evolving**. We've traversed our **first community-added advance** and formed a bond with Kusama and its community. For this reason, we would like to **thank all the pit** **members**. See you soon with new news. 

Now or never.

title: X世界第一季——重启
body:
作者内容：Colter，背景图片作者：Mr.7

写作日期：2022年5月31日

> X历2135年，6月8日周六中午12点，B星Z市。

寒风夹杂着雪花在呼啸着，山峰被厚厚的冰层覆盖着，这座山峰叫紫山，海拔6700米，因为地形复杂、山壁崎岖陡峭、环境恶劣闻名，并且这座山峰属于禁区，每天会有全副武装人员在山脚下巡逻，禁止任何人员进入。

山脚下的树林中，两名巡逻人员慢慢走过来，他们全身武装到没有任何皮肤裸露在外面，手指全都放在武器的激发按键上，随时可以进入射击状态。

咻--- 一个极速且细不可闻的声音划过这个空间。

只见这两名巡逻人员突然都不动了，然后身体快速分解成几块坠入地面。 离这里不到5米远的一处丛林的光线出现一点异样，一名身穿迷彩色全覆盖护甲的人型生物从空气中浮现，他快速走到事发地旁边的树干上，从上面取下了一个被苔藓覆盖的物体，按了一下，上面覆盖的苔藓就消失不见了，一个六角形的黑色扁装物体出现在手中，人型生物随手把它挂在腰部，然后弯下腰，掏出一个小型圆筒状物体对准地上的尸块按了下，只见尸块连同附近的装备以肉眼可见的速度消失不见。 

当做完这些事后，那个人形生物便慢慢消失在空气中，仿佛这一切从未发生过。 

张毅，编号15901，隶属A国特殊战斗组，今天接到一个任务，需要他去紫山刺杀E151目标，据情报表明，E151会在下午5点到6点之间通过秘密通道进入紫山内。

 “紫山位于Z国断峰山脉，已探明紫山为Z国的AZ177基地部署地，此基地长期研发及测试新型武器装备，属于Z国最高级别的基地，紫山地形图及AZ177基地详情图已经发给你了，准备好你的装备，5分钟后出发。”张毅的眼前出现这条信息，紧接脑中着便出现了关于紫山及AZ177的全部资料。 

他快速走到基地的装备库，找到唯一一个胶囊状装备舱，拉开装备舱门躺入进去，舱门便自动关上，紧接着装备舱下的地板出现一个圆形口，胶囊状的装备舱直接下坠到圆形口内，然后圆形口自动关上，整个装备库便空空如也，仿佛这里面不存在任何东西。

 一艘小型黑色飞船静静的停在机库里，尾部开着小舱门与一根管道连接着，这时飞船背部的亮了一下红光，尾部舱门便自动关上，管道与飞船尾部舱门断开连接。

“飞鸟会带你到离紫山10公里处的地方进行空投，你需要陆地上进行潜入，离紫山2公里处，禁止使用一切飞行设备。”躺在装备舱中的张毅眼前继续浮现这列信息。

“预计你的抵达时间为下午1点，你只有240分钟进入目标出现地，晚上8点之前需要返回预定的坐标地，会有飞鸟接你回家的。”

躺在装备舱的张毅，缓缓闭上了双眼。

小型飞船机身轻微晃动了一下，没有任何征兆的从地面起飞，缓缓飞向机库顶部敞开的天窗，飞出机库后，飞船闪现一道蓝色的光芒，瞬间飞向远处的天空。

A国特殊战斗组的指挥厅内，一名身材高大，穿着黑色铠甲的人看着面前显示器中的飞船远去的画面，眼神中透漏着冰冷的气息。

张毅轻轻摇了摇头，努力让自己从任务的回忆中拉回现实，毕竟他刚刚解决了两名巡逻人员，在紫山这样严密的基地，哪怕一丝走神都可能会让任务失败。

他看了看了眼前投射出的X战甲系统运行数据，没有发现任何异常，按照战甲的能量存储，还足够他进行8小时的使用时长。张毅弯下身悄无声息的按照投射出的地形图，快速前进。

从山脚到攀登点的这一路上，没有再遇到任何巡逻哨卡，看来是紫山这个天险让Z国的部分地面力量部署减少了，张毅心中暗道。

很快张毅便抵达了预定攀登点，根据情报显示，进入紫山秘密基地唯一的可能性是在此处进行攀登，依靠原始攀登设备抵达山壁中的通风洞穴才能潜入基地。

攀登点下，张毅解除了X战甲的隐形功能，换成了雪山迷彩的外观，因为隐形功能会快速消耗战甲的能量储备，特别是这种需要长时间的重复攀登，很可能会增加战甲的消耗速度，对于此类刺杀任务，能节省能量就尽量节省，留着保命。

他抬头看了看巍峨的雪山，启动了战甲手脚处的引力系统，然后手脚并用，开始一点点向上攀爬。强大的引力系统牢牢的让张毅吸附在冰雪上，他看了眼信息，离山壁中间的通风洞穴还有2000米，张毅深吸一口气，咬了咬牙，顶着雪山的大风朝着预定地点坚定的行进。

山壁中间的通风洞穴是一个天然形成的通道，紫山内部进行建设基地的时候，几乎挖空了整座山峰内部，为了确保内部的空气流通性，除了天然形成的洞穴还额外开凿了几处人工通风口，这些通风口内部都安装有多种监控设备，形成完整的监测系统。

整个紫山基地耗费Z国十年时间及大量的人力资金建设，基地被全方位的安全巡逻系统保护，号称不会有任何物体可以在不惊动安全系统的情况下进入。

“警告，还有10分钟，紫山巡逻机会经过您所在的山壁。”头盔面罩中的投射板泛起了红色光芒，张毅看了看信息，离这个通风洞穴还有1200米远，以当前的速度绝无可能在巡逻机抵达之前就到达洞穴中。

张毅迅速打量了环境，空荡荡的雪山壁没有任何物体可供隐藏，他一咬牙，直接加快速度向上攀登。

“警告，心率过快，血氧饱和度降低。”红色信息急促的提醒着张毅，他没有理睬，默默调高了机甲的氧气输出量，继续加快了速度。

“警告，还有3分30秒，紫山巡逻机会经过您所在的山壁。”此时的张毅已经顾不上这个提醒，他没有别的选择，只能奋力继续攀登，否则必然会被发现。

“倒计时60秒开始，请做好隐蔽准备。”

“拼了！”张毅在面罩下的眼神突然变得无比坚定，他唤起战甲肩膀处的小型离子枪，对准右侧的不远处山壁上方一块凸起的冰块，然后调整为小功率持续模式，一道淡蓝色的离子束精准的射向冰块。

瞬间冰块被洞穿，但并未出现预想中的冰块掉落，张毅额头开始出现一点汗水，他反手从腰间掏出一颗冲击波手雷，这颗手雷还是张毅在上一次任务中获得的战利品之一，冲击波手雷在如今已经是老古董了，除了收藏价值就没有实战价值了。

张毅降下面罩，露出了年轻的面庞，没一会儿高空缺氧和寒冷就让他的脸色开始发青，他用牙咬掉拉环，用空出来的右手使劲把手雷丢向右侧上方的冰块，然后升起面罩。

手雷完美的划过一道抛物线，精准的到达冰块附近。

“轰”—— 

手雷爆炸，冲击波席卷而出，冰块瞬间被粉碎，巨大的响声响彻山壁，雪山上的大量冰层瞬间被激活，疯狂的向下砸下来，冲击波被战甲轻松抵挡，巨大滚落的雪块蜂拥而至，瞬间淹没了整个区域。

巨大的动静瞬间引起紫山巡逻机的注意，天空中的巡逻机划过一道蓝光抵达此处，巡逻机中的驾驶员看着雪崩的场景，摇了摇头，把实时画面传输给了监控系统，然后驾机驶离此处。

雪崩一直持续了几分钟才逐渐停下来，战甲下的张毅脸色已经由青转紫了，他大口的喘着粗气，身体不自主的颤抖着，脑海一片空白，听不到任何的声音，强烈的求生欲让他一直苦苦支撑，这时他的眼睛开始慢慢看不清四周，天地间只剩一片白色，嘴角溢出了一丝鲜血。

恍惚间，张毅好像看到了他之前参加训练的场景，听到了战友们在旁边大声呼喊着他的名字，好像也看到E151目标向他微笑的样子。

“这就是死亡吗？”张毅喃喃自语。“警告，身体指标异常，启动紧急系统。”张毅的耳边传来了战甲的声音。

伴随着紧急系统的启动及无情的战甲声音让张毅开始能听到外界的风声，能看到面具投射的红色信息。

张毅再一次被拉回了现实，他下意识的用一只手擦拭嘴角的鲜血，但只摸到了坚硬的战甲面罩。他向上望了望，面具显示离通风洞穴还有1000米，然后看了看脚下，苦笑了起来。

就在此时，天空中出现一道诡异的黑色闪电划破整个天际，但却没有任何声音传来，紧接着连续几道黑色闪电不断出现，他恍惚间好像看到了黑色闪电周围出现了空间扭曲的情况。

“警告，检测到未知能量体。”红色的警告急促的在提醒着张毅。

这时候，出现黑色闪电的天空开始出现塌陷，黑色的空间逐渐暴露出来，这种黑色好像有勾人心魄的能力，让张毅觉得自己的身体与思想完全不能同步。

朦胧间，一根无比巨大像手指一样的东西从黑色空间中伸出一点点，但是瞬间缩回去了，然后黑色空间开始在一点点缩小。

“轰”——

白色的闪电划破黑色的空间，直接刺透进黑色里面，瞬间产生了巨大的爆炸声，一股强大的冲击波以肉眼可见的空间波动席卷开来。

张毅面色惨白，抬头望向山峰，眼睁睁的看着被冲击波席卷产生掉落的雪块向下砸来。

“警告，警告，警告，系统能量值降低，战甲破损在扩大。”张毅的耳边只剩下无情的系统提示音，然后眼前一黑。

“李博士，脉冲好像不对，你看看这个数据。”

“咦？是有点不对，你把参数重新调下，减少能量输出。”

“李博士，这个也不对，外界反馈信息会形成交互，好像有自我意识的潜在表现。”

“重启系统！”

“张毅，起床了！醒醒！”紧接着一双手在张毅身上推动起来，“吵死了，大早上喊什么！”张毅一股无名之火瞬间冒起，他眼睛一睁，一巴掌拍飞这双手”李小松，你是有病吗，今天是周末！”

“张毅，你怕是睡糊涂了啊？今天是周一，咱们要去考试，这课要没有参加考试，怕是毕业证都拿不到了。”李小松看着躺着床上的张毅说到。

“今天周一了啊，我怎么感觉今天是周末？”听闻李小松的话，张毅一骨碌起床，然后看了下房间里的时间“6月10日周一，上午7点34”。

“还真是周一，赶紧赶紧，今天考试不参加死定了。”张毅抛下这句话就直奔厕所。

在厕所中，张毅拿着毛巾抬头看向镜子，一副陌生的脸庞出现在镜子中，没有一丝丝熟悉感，一瞬间张毅好像被闪电击中了一样，呆在这里一动不动。

“数据异常，重启系统！”

title: 《乘风破浪》第三季：宁静VS那英，两个女人的“战争”
body:
ROUND 1 初次交锋 平分秋色

宁静、那英在《乘风破浪》第三季的节目中初次相见，两人本着“没有最冲，只有更冲”的原则，你来我往，针锋相对。

宁静说：别人是来争第一的，我是来超越第一的!

那英也丝毫不让，傲娇的说：那我可比她（宁静）地位高，我是她前辈。

两人一见面就电光火石、气场全开，谁也不怵谁。

编辑

那英说：别给我玩阴的就行，我不喜欢拐弯抹角。

宁静回怼：你看我是会拐弯抹角的人吗？

那英：不知道。

宁静：我会！我可会“拐”了！

天啊，这火药味，感觉马上就能打起来，第一局，宁静、那英两位大姐大可谓分庭抗礼、平分秋色。

编辑

ROUND 2 抢队长 那英胜

在初舞台表演之后，谭维维、吴莫愁、阿雅、刘恋、赵梦、于文文六位姐姐获得队长之位。

那英、宁静的首要任务就是抢队长。

凭借在歌坛的江湖地位，那英毫不费力的抢到了谭维维、吴莫愁这两员VOCAL大将，并将有创意、又全能的刘恋收入麾下。

而相比之下，一直气场强大的宁静却显得畏手畏脚，败下阵来，大VOCAL一个没抢到，只收获善于沟通交际的阿雅、摇滚范儿的赵梦，以及那英宁静谁也不敢要、“不好摆弄”的于文文。

从这场“抢队长”的战局来看，能够非常清晰的看出那英、宁静两人的个性。

编辑

那英素来以直来直去、口无遮拦著称，所以一上来，就非常明确的表态，她喜欢谭维维、喜欢吴莫愁，这看似是直爽、直接、不拐弯抹角，但实则体现出的是一种“霸道”，即“我管你宁静怎么想，管别人怎么想，反正我想要谁我就直接抢”；这一招非常奏效，毕竟谭维维、吴莫愁同为歌手，与那英的私人关系也很好，那英一招呼，指定火速投奔。

编辑

再看宁静，在以前的节目里都是说一不二，很强势的样子。可在那英面前，却吃了哑巴亏，她也想要谭维维、吴莫愁，无奈那英先发制人，她只能采取迂回战术。从这一点看，宁静还是个挺有气度的女人，虽然也叫嚣了一下，笑着直言：那英你不要太过分，占了谭维维，还想占吴莫愁。但最后还是选择了避其锋芒、坦然接受。毕竟要真是和那英杠起来，两人势必一番唇枪舌剑，然后搞得谁都不愉快，也让其他人尴尬为难。

编辑

ROUND 3 抢队员 那英胜

抢完队长，接着就是抢队员了。

那英在这一局又是先下手为强，老早就表达了对齐溪的喜欢和欣赏，还亲自出马搞定徐梦桃、许茹芸等大将。

宁静同盟的阿雅、于文文、赵梦虽然也非常给力，拿下张蔷、郑秀妍、郭采洁、张天爱等姐姐，但相比之下，宁静还是有点轻敌了，在这个环节，如果队长能够亲力亲为，像那英那样更为卖力的去抢人，也许会争取到更多姐姐的支持，拿到更多小红花。

最终，那英同盟获得42朵小红花，宁静同盟只拿到24朵，在下一环节“选歌”环节将自己逼入绝境。

编辑

ROUND 4 抢歌 旗鼓相当

虽然小红花数量少，形势不妙。但是在“抢歌”环节，宁静同盟却展现了超高的智商和演技，打了一个漂亮的翻身仗，以24朵小红花孤注一掷，抢到了他们最喜欢的唱秀歌曲《自己》，同时也不费一兵一卒就拿到了自己相对喜欢的《情书》、《要你管》，从这一战能够看出来，宁静还真的挺有智慧，很会玩！

她也用实际行动告诉那英：我可会“拐”了！

编辑

ROUND 5 第一次公演 宁静胜（根据网络消息推测）

下一战，将是第一次公演舞台，从此前爆出的淘汰名单看，一公淘汰的是那英同盟的吴莫愁和黄小蕾，说明宁静同盟确实爆冷战胜了那英同盟。

这也印证了那句话：一分耕耘、一分收获，一切都是最好的安排。

那英自以为本同盟的阵容豪华，自己又很专业，训练的时候起的晚、结束的早，直呼轻松，还到处闲逛、用手机打麻将，并和自己队员说笑称“宁静那组都崩溃了”，可现实却是对手大胜，这可是“啪啪打脸”。

那英、宁静，两个大姐大的“战争”还在继续，让我们拭目以待，看她们乘风破浪！

title: Open social graphs and the ownership opportunity (/memo)
body:
Marbel is a web3 native communication platform. We built Marbel as a better way to foster collaboration between DAO members while allowing them to build their digital identity with their contributions. DAOs can host hubs for their communities, where each tokenized community features a Discourse-like discussion board. This is a one-pager that summarises the core premises, product, functionality and growth prospects.

## The problem: DAOs are missing a native coordination layer

The current coordination infrastructure used by DAOs is relying too heavily on web2 solutions. Solutions that look like enterprise SaaS instead of multiplayer. Why is it?

For once, the lack of alternatives makes the switch impossible. Communication tools like Discourse and Discord have been filling the gap for crypto communities with increasingly apps and bots to power their communities or API calls to offer their centralised content.

We all know saw what happens when the tools we use depend too heavily on centralized players (See Aave Founder being blocked by Twitter or Bankless DAO channel being blocked by Youtube).

Crypto-native communities deserve crypto-native software. User databases are siloed, there is no cross-chain reputation and solutions are missing on new frontiers enabled by crypto.

And we’re early. DAOs remove the barrier for the five billion internet users to trust and coordinate capital with anyone on the internet. According to DeepDAO, there are 4.8k DAOs with $10B treasury and only 1.7M token holders! More crypto-first coordination tools are required.

  Check [a user on the MakerDAO Discourse](https://forum.makerdao.com/u/longforwisdom/summary).

The same user on multiple Discourse forums will lose all this information and start from scratch.

## The solution: Marbel and incentives

We’re ready to go one extra mile. We can reinvent the way people communicate, develop and coordinate ideas. Marbel is an opportunity to build a decentralized communication layer on top of the onchain social graph.

By building Marbel, we add social, collaborative, and productivity components that, otherwise, would exist in different off-chain silos. Tools for feedback, voting and decision-making will emerge for every user.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RGjqFWK3YZCqzU4mPDijr.png?height=880&width=1600)

On our initial PoC we developed an implementation that leverages Lens protocol to create a place where community members can share and discuss relevant resources for the community. We also show what sets of information are to live on the blockchain and what others are to be stored in [IPFS](https://www.discourse.org/).

[Live demo](https://themarbel.com/) (testnet)

## Vision

Social protocols will define how people organize and how culture flows by allowing digital-age coordination at scale. Open social graphs are the crypto-native approach to rearchitecting the traditional tech stack.

## Moving from Enabler to Grower

Community tooling has evolved immensely in the past 2 years. But there is a clear distinction to make when it comes to incentives. Marbel is designed to fall nicely under the Grower label. Marbel helps contributors take the next step, with modules to increase the value of the end-user.

The ability to own your contributions and bring your badges with you means that people can now build their reputation on their own terms. The days of waiting for someone else to decide whether or not you are worthy of recognition are over.

With an open state database, everyone can see who has contributed what, how often they contribute, and how much value those contributions have created for others. This approach was not possible before because it would take too long for someone else to verify the validity of one's contributions using conventional methods like peer review or other forms of verification by third parties.

Join our discord if you want to collaborate with us: 

### Core Overview

We choose to build on Polygon due to its low-cost transactions. This is because even with Ethereum rollups where transaction costs are over $1, low-value transactions such as following and upvoting would not be economical.

Moreover, we expect to use content management protocols like Ceramic (content storage on top of IPFS) and Lit Protocol (privacy via content access control) to manage and store content file data.

Using a social graph protocol like Lens allows us to use the implemented core primitives in a composable fashion.

Lens is extendable and EVM compatible, which means that developers will be able to add features on top of the core primitives that will expand even more the capabilities of Marbel. This approach is clearly distinct from social graph protocols like [DeSO](https://www.deso.org/) and the full stack application [dm.xyz](https://gm.xyz/)

## The Marbel loop

Our strategic starting point is in the discussion for protocol DAOs. We believe Protocol DAOs are the most resilient and active in the ecosystem and dominating that niche will be a great starting point.

Part of our core metric is developing liquidity over scale early on. Building enough value for crucial DAOs to migrate operations to another platform at once.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rtHJSE981Bhr1npbzvAje.png?height=695&width=1437)

## Key features

On-chain interactions will also bring novel ways to interact with DAO members. Specifically, we envision this is a novel approach to community aligned metrics where contributors will be able to [prove](https://twitter.com/StaniKulechov/status/1529544441303863296) and benefit from being actively involved. Developing an on-chain reputation through these interactions will play a key role for the participants of any digital economy.

Applications like Discourse monetize through subscriptions. Marbel, however, isn’t limited to the direct selling of licenses or subscriptions. Marbel modules will be pre-configured to serve different functions, such as targetted airdrops based on the social graph, sentiment analysis on the community or access to gated sections.

Communities have to rely on tools like [SourceCred](https://sourcecred.io/) to encourage and activate their community by rewarding their most active users. Opening up collaborators to earn cash implies that economic value is not derived from speculation, but rather from *commerce.* This evolves into tipping capabilities or even curate2earn dynamics.

Once the social graph is formed, the relationships are unforkable, which cements the social graph in the network and attracts other protocols to service the revenues and utilize potential undercollateralized aspects.

## Challenges

At this point, there is no doubt about how powerful are the open social graphs. Owning your engagement and identity is a no-brainer for anyone starting the journey in web3. WE’ve identified 2 challenges that will need to be overcome in a relatively short time:

* Technological challenges. Any meaningful social network would produce significant transaction amount that far exceeds the current chain throughput. Because with Lens the state of every retweet, post comment, etc, is a transaction, there needs to be a sustainable model of gasless transactions through relayers. There are some open questions whether subnets or token incentives can balance out these costs.
* User Experience. Web3 has for long relied heavily on the desktop experience. But we know that mobile is by far the preferred way to access communication. Finding the optimal balance between connecting identities and engagement in DAOs will also revolve around clean and intuitive products.

## Final thoughts

With Marbel we see a legitimate opportunity to bring the next wave of users to crypto. Contributors who are genuinely interested in collaborating and working with others and be accountable for it.

Marbel it’s an opportunity for DAOs to finally engage with their community in a meaningful way. Social and crypto are powerful and so are the gamified ramifications of including an open graph of our contributions.

title: Solidity 课程 10: 继承
Stories help us understand the World.
body:
![Foto de Dmitry Demidov en Pexels](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*iyEWdts27L1ceBq3h7BEzA.jpeg)

Stories make us see the world from a different perspective. One that we ourselves are not likely to see through, Whether it is real, fiction or myths.

Through stories, we learn things from experiences of other people and characters, we see the results of doing certain things so that in the future we can avoid doing it, or see the benefits of those actions and apply it to our own current situation in our life.

We tell ourselves stories all the time, these are stories our brain creates trying to figure out what will happen next, what will happen if I or that person performs a certain action.

![Foto de Pixabay en Pexels](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*tOuA3kpMjzoW3UrJvWSGig.jpeg)

Often if someone tell us our faults directly we don’t listen to them, we even feel attacked and resentful sometimes, and there are not a lot of people who are pointing out our faults to us, maybe they think about them, but they would not say it, and we are like this too.

We don’t tend to tell people when they are acting in a wrong way, unless it is very wrong, at least that is my experience (unless it is twitter, where people assume other people’s faults just with reading one sentence), and honestly I don’t think we should, I think that is an individual own journey to figure out what he/she is doing wrong, but we do need input from somewhere as individuals, and the best inputs are stories.

With stories, we get to see the world from a different perspective, we get to “live” through different life times and see and experience the world from different individual's perspectives, and we learn from these stories without literally living them.

It’s easier for us to evaluate stories from an objective light than what other people say or try to teach us directly.

For examples, stories like The Tortoise and the Hare teaches us to that it might not be right to do things as fast as you can, that slow and steady is better, there is a saying in the racing world that goes like;

> Slow is smooth and smooth is fast.

From David and Goliath, we learn that if you are on a disadvantage against your opponent, you have opportunities to win as well.

The older stories survive, the more valuable they become, there is a reason they have been passed through thousands of years, and it is probably because they are truth, no in the literal sense many times, but in how we identify inside them as humans. Through the pass of time, they become [Lindy](https://www.wealest.com/articles/lindy-effect).

The [hero’s Journey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hero%27s_journey) if one of the stories that have been repeated thousands of times, thousands of ways, from ancient myths to every superhero movie, we have seen this story countless times.

![source](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*N88hK94n7KWchHejDdh0mg.png)

We tell ourselves Stories all the time, they help us understand ourselves, other people and events, stories are a core part of the human experience, the stories that permeate time have universal wisdom in them, that is the only reason they would survive that long.

That's all I wanted to say about stories, thanks for reading :)

This article was inspired by the book wrote by Jordan Peterson, [maps of meaning](https://amzn.to/3wCUrNp).

title: 我与两位钱先生的书缘
body:
我羡慕江苏文艺出版社的编辑家张昌华，他写了《我给他们照过相》，讲述自己探访上百位文化名人，为他们留下珍贵影像的故事。我也羡慕记者出身的作家李辉，他写了《与老人聊天》，记录自己从青年时代结识的诸多前辈学者与他的交往。我写不出这样的文字，因为我手头没有足够的资料。其实细细想来，从1982年到1996年，我在人民文学出版社（以下简称“人文社”）工作14年，接触的老一代作家学者也为数不少，从丁玲、艾青、胡风、唐弢开始，总有几十人，但是我竟然找不出一张自己与他们的合影。那时与名家见面，是根本意识不到需要拍照留念的。而八、九十年代，我也还没有开始写日记，甚至名家学者给我的信件，我都没有特意收藏，有些也丢失了。想想觉得自己真不能算是有心人。但想开了也觉得没有什么，也就是到晚年以后，少一点怀旧的材料而已。

 
 

不过，有两位令我极为尊崇的老先生，我与他们的书缘颇深，但我却未能前往拜见，面聆教诲，这是使我深感遗憾的事。这两位先生，就是钱锺书和钱学森。

 

                        （一）

我是在大学时代知道钱锺书先生的。我的毕业论文指导教师、武汉大学中文系罗立乾先生对钱锺书佩服得五体投地，在古代文论课堂上就大讲钱锺书先生的学问天下无敌，说他博闻强记，“《十三经》连注释都能背”，令我印象极深。后来中华书局出版《管锥编》四卷本，我毫不犹豫就买下一套，那大概是我大学四年中购买的最为厚重的学术著作。虽然以当时的学力根本不能通读，只是选读了一些篇章，读得似懂非懂，但内心很满足，感觉是念到了真经。后来到“人文社”当编辑，工作中发现夏志清和杨义的两种《中国现代小说史》都高度评价小说《围城》，于是又找来读，立时被作品中鲜活的人物性格吸引，读得入迷，对作者的才华、睿智和幽默的文笔惊叹不已。

 
 

说起来，我对钱锺书的崇拜，也部分地来源于家父。家父长期在清华大学外语系任教，建国初期，曾与钱锺书、杨绛夫妇同事。钱、杨都教英文，家父主教俄文，有时也教英文。家父多次对我谈到他对钱锺书的钦佩，说他自己的英文水平约略相当于英国本地大学毕业生的水平，但是钱锺书可以胜过清华聘请的英籍、美籍教授。于是我有了一个印象：以学贯中西而论，钱锺书堪称中国现代史上第一人。家父和钱锺书的关系似乎也不错。那时的人仰慕苏俄，有一次课堂上学生希望钱锺书开讲俄罗斯文学，钱说自己研究不多，推荐家父去讲。家父对此还很有几分荣幸之感。

 
 

不过，自从1952年高校院系调整，钱、杨二人离开清华大学，家父和他们没有再见过面。而我，虽然在“人文社”当编辑，但钱锺书的《围城》、《宋诗选注》的编辑都另有其人，自然也无缘接近钱、杨二老的。然而，偏巧在1993年，出现了一场和《围城》相关的法律纠纷，钱锺书委托“人文社”处理此案，而“人文社”陈早春社长又要求我代表出版社将此纠纷诉诸法庭，于是我也算是受命于钱先生打了一场官司。

 
 

事情起因是四川文艺出版社以所谓“汇校”的名义，原样复制了“人文社”1980年出版的《围城》，侵犯了钱锺书的著作权和“人文社”的专有出版权。打官司打得旷日持久，在此不必详谈，这里只说钱先生曾经为表达自己的意见，两次写信给我和出版社领导以及我们委托的律师陆志敏。今天我实在不记得自己给钱先生回过信。那时的我，是不大懂礼数的。为了听取意见和获得授权，社里当然会安排专人去府上拜访钱先生，我记得律师陆志敏和总编室的有关人员都去了，而那天我忙于其他安排，竟然也没去。整个官司进行过程中，我们和钱先生的沟通主要通过钱媛。钱媛也很忙，几次到社里与我们会面，乘公交车来往风尘仆仆。我记得她说过自己腰疼，和我们谈话时喜欢站着，用手抵住后腰。但那时她自己也并不知道，这可能就是骨髓癌早期的症状。

 
 

偏巧钱媛也与我有缘。她是北师大外语系教授，与家父都在北京市大学外语教学研究会任职，彼此熟识。特别是钱媛升职教授，家父还是专家评审组的负责人之一。所以钱媛见到我就特别亲切，正事谈完，还会和我闲聊一些她儿时在清华园里的经历。告诉我，她家和我家曾同住清华北院。她不仅从小认识我大姐，而且认识我母亲。她夸我母亲长得漂亮，喜欢穿什么款式的旗袍，喜欢和哪位教授夫人一起遛弯儿，还说她10来岁时，总爱跑到清华音乐室去玩，在墙外攀上大窗台听合唱队在屋里唱歌，有时会看到我母亲在弹钢琴。这些对我都是“史前史”，听来非常有趣。初次见面，钱媛回家把在“人文社”和我相遇的情况对父母一说，她父母也非常高兴，觉得把官司委托给我，是缘分。其实在这时，我是完全可以名正言顺地请她带我去见钱、杨二老的。但是我愚钝，竟然没有这样想过。

 

  

 
  
 

人民文学出版社出版的《围城》

 

 

钱先生的《围城》官司在上海中级人民法院开庭，因为涉及的侵权问题颇为复杂，法院征询了诸多知识产权专家意见，拖了三年多才宣判。结果是我们打赢了，而且是完胜，我们代表钱锺书先生讨回了公道。随即我也在1996年底被借调到香港三联书店工作。

 
 

本来我以为没有机会再为钱先生做事，没想到刚到香港，我就接手编辑出版一套钱锺书主编、朱维铮执行主编的《中国近代学术名著丛书》。这套书在学术上分量很重，原计划出版50种，后因各种客观原因，只出版了10种，但光是这10种已经足够让学术界刮目相看了，因为人们知道钱先生的原则从来是不当官，不挂虚名，不当各种顾问和编委，而这是钱先生一生中同意列名主编的唯一一套丛书。整套书是香港三联和北京三联联合制作的，编辑和排版工作都在香港完成，由我主持其事。此时钱先生还健在，但是我仍然没有意识到自己在回北京出差或休假时，应该借这个机会去向他老人家登门请教。

 
 

然后我在香港又出版了杨绛先生的散文集《从丙午到流亡》。这时是1999年，从此我和杨绛先生有了直接的联系。2005年我回到北京三联书店任职以后，更是经常会到府上看望杨先生，渐渐与杨先生熟悉起来，为她老人家出版了一系列作品。2007年，北京三联重新出版经过修订的《钱锺书集》（第二版），我也是参与谋划的，此书在南京举行新书发布会，我还特地飞到南京去致辞。这算是我与钱先生后续的书缘。但遗憾的是，此时钱锺书先生已经去世多年，连钱媛也不在了，痛哉！钱先生和我最终缘铿一面，惜哉！

 
 

 

                          （二）

我与钱学森先生的缘分也在于编书。

 
 

1994年，我担任责任编辑，在“人文社”出版了钱学森的《科学的艺术与艺术的科学》一书。编这本书，对我既有偶然性，也有必然性。说偶然，是因为本书的编者，钱学森的堂妹钱学敏刚刚收到一封信，这是钱学森写给包括她在内的一个7人小集体，以“亲密无间”“坦率陈言”的态度“探讨学问”，提出了“科学的艺术”与“艺术的科学”这样两个命题，于是使她产生灵感，要为钱先生编这本书。说是必然，是因为我早在80年代，就已经密切关注了钱学森在人文社会科学方面诸多引领学术思考的论文，早有为他编书的念头，只是还没有找到机会向他约稿。

 
 

钱学敏的到来令我感到惊喜。她是中国人民大学哲学系的教授，对钱学森的学术思想非常熟悉。她把那封关于科学与艺术的亲笔信给我看，我了解到钱先生的本意是这样：

 
 

“近日我深感我国文艺人和文艺理论工作者对高新技术不了解之病。我经常收到的有关文艺、文化的刊物有《中流》、《文艺研究》和《文艺理论与批评》，而其中除美学理论外都是：1，骂资产阶级自由化分子；2，发牢骚；3，论中国古代的文艺辉煌。但就是缺对新文艺形式的探讨，研究科学技术发展所能提供的新的文艺手段”。

 
 

他认为这样不行，今天的理论界应该研究如何用高新技术为社会主义文艺服务，如何使科学与艺术相结合从而繁荣文艺创作和理论，希望大家研究。

 
 

我看信后觉得，钱先生提出的问题具有现实针对性。他批评的几个刊物，都常常发表思想保守、抵触文艺创新观念的文章，因而在客观上阻碍了“对文艺新形式的探讨”。钱先生在此时提出将科学与艺术相结合的观点，无疑可以活跃学术空气，拓展艺术思维空间，推进理论研究。

 
 

钱学敏带来了她编好的论文集目录和样稿，我浏览了一遍，当即决定出版这本书。但是我发现，钱学敏的编选比较拘谨，她只选择钱先生讨论科学与艺术两者关系的文章，以及他从科学角度谈文艺学和美学的论文，把选文范围牢牢扣住“科学”和“艺术”这两个主题，但是钱先生另有一些极富理论开创性的论文并没有收进来。

 
 

文化界的老一代读者或许了解，80年代，钱学森堪称中国思想界领军人物之一。他1981年在《自然杂志》上发表的《系统科学、思维科学与人体科学》，以及后续的一系列论文，是国内最早出现的新学科理论。后来作为时髦的理论被人们热衷探讨的系统论、控制论、信息论，即大家耳熟能详的所谓“三论”，早在这些文章里面都有雏形。钱先生的论述，以开放的观念，宏观的视野，前沿的科学知识，创新性的思维方式，给人们带来了耳目一新的思想理论，引起学术界广泛瞩目乃至轰动。我记得那时尝试新学科研究的学者，没有不谈钱学森的。

 
 

我问钱学敏，为什没有收录有关思维科学的文章？她说她是为了突出专题性，担心文章驳杂而主题不集中。我说，以系统科学和思维科学研究艺术，不也正是科学与艺术相结合的一个方面吗？这对于钱先生谈论的艺术的科学相当重要，甚至是其指导性理论。她想想，觉得有道理，于是同意将钱先生的《系统科学、思维科学与人体科学》《关于思维科学》《开展思维科学研究》这三篇最有代表性的思维科学论文收入。事后，她曾专门来信感谢我，说她和钱先生讨论过了，认为我的建议，在很大程度上提高了这本理论集的学术含量，使一本原来略显单薄的书厚重起来。

 
 

编辑中，我和钱先生没有直接联系，我对于出版的一切建议，都通过钱学敏转达。我的意见和建议，不过都是从出版角度所做的一些编选方面的考虑，钱先生从善如流，我们合作非常愉快。不过他也很认真，例如，作为设计的一部分，封面上要署上英文书名，该如何翻译？我原来以为简单，无非用是 《The art of science and the science of art》但是钱先生说，艺术特指优美的艺术，应该用The fine art 来表示。最后书名译成《The fine art with science and the science of fine art》，是他亲自改定的。

 
 

接下来的事情很顺利。“人文社”非常重视这本书，我们做了精装本，请设计师柳成荫做了一个大气典雅的装帧，只用了三四个月就出书了。钱先生看到样书，非常满意。

 
 

一两个星期后，我收到一本钱先生寄来的样书，内封上写着：

 
 

李昕同志：

感谢您为此书付出的辛勤劳动。 

钱学森 1994,12,9

 
 

为了宣传和推广，我写了一篇书评，发表在《科技日报》上。想必钱先生也看到了。所以没过多久，我又收到一本钱先生寄来的样书，内封上写着：

 
 

李昕同志：

感谢您的书评。

钱学森 1995,1,5

 
 

由此我了解到钱先生的细心、周到以及他平易近人的性格。可是我仍然没有想起，应该请钱学敏引荐我去拜访一次钱先生，与他拍一张合影留念。

 
 

于今想来，那时的我可能有几分木讷吧。

 
 

出书以后，我忙于编务，与钱学森、钱学敏都没有继续联系，一晃过去十几年。

 
 

2009年10月31日是一个周六，那天上午，我在家里上网浏览，无意中看到一则新闻：

 

中国科学巨星钱学森于在北京逝世，享年98岁。钱学森是中国航天科技事业的先驱和杰出代表，被誉为“中国航天之父”和“火箭之王”。

 

震惊之余，我立刻给钱学敏打电话。她在电话里证实了这个不幸的消息。我表达了沉痛的悼念，请她向钱夫人蒋英转达。随后我又立即想到，我是否可以到钱先生府上吊唁？她说可以，钱先生家里已经设立灵堂。我向她询问了钱宅的地址。

 
 

钱学森先生是我深为爱戴的科学家，也是我作者中最值得尊敬的人。我觉得，尽管我从没有去府上拜访过他，但在这个时候，我必须去一趟，到灵堂为他送行。

 

 

 
 

钱学森先生赠我的两本《科学的艺术与艺术的科学》

 

 

于是我驾车前往。进航天部宿舍大门没有遇到盘查，门房的人只问我去哪里，我说钱宅，他挥挥手就让我进去了。

 
 

在钱先生居住的那栋红砖楼附近，我停下车，徒步走过去。

 
 

那天，天色很暗，头上阴云密布。论时令，还没有入冬，但是很奇怪，天上竟然飘起了雪花，且寒风凛凛。我想，莫非是天地同悲？远远地，我看到楼房边人群黑压压一片。大约有两三百人密集地聚在楼房一侧，而身着黑色和蓝色两种不同制服的警察站成两排，将人群阻挡住，以便在楼前留出一块较大的空场。不时，可以看到有小轿车开到楼前空场上，有领导干部模样的人下车进入楼内。还见到几个身穿军装带大盖帽的人物，一溜小跑鱼贯而入。

 
 

人群中不时有人提问，“我们要进灵堂悼念，何时放我们进去？”但没有人回答。

 
 

我在人群中站立了一会儿，只见雪越下越大，有些人身上已经白了。我也感到有些寒冷。

 
 

我觉得这样等下去不是办法。于是独自走上前去，叫住一个穿黑衣的警察。我掏出一张名片递给他说，请他把这张名片交给钱夫人蒋英女士。

 
 

那警察进屋去了。过了几分钟，他回到我面前，说：你可以进去。

 
 

我正准备脱离人群，就听到人群开始骚动，警察们马上手拉手维持秩序，只放行我一人。

 
 

钱宅在那座三层小楼的一层。家门开着，我径直走进去，正对着的就是灵堂，我往侧面一看，在另一个房间里，蒋英和几个面色凝重的人正坐在一圈沙发上谈话。我觉得不便打扰，就走向灵堂。灵堂正中悬挂着钱先生照片，周围摆放了不少花圈和花篮，但没有一个人在屋子里。我独自上前，默默地对着钱先生遗像站立了一会，缅怀他老人家的丰功伟绩，然后深深地鞠了三个躬。

 
 

从钱宅出来，聚集的人群见到我，立刻将我团团围住。一些好奇的人想打听里面的情况，但是还没等我来得及回应，就有三五只长枪短炮的照相机镜头对准了我。他们是新闻记者，有国内的也有香港的。以一家香港报纸为主，向我提问。主要问题是我和钱先生的渊源，以及我对钱先生的评价。我首先简单讲了我给钱先生编辑《科学的艺术与艺术的科学》的经历，然后告诉他们，钱先生不仅仅是一位伟大的科学家，而且也是一位令人尊敬的人文学者，一位跨领域的文理兼通的大师。他的博学和深刻，都是一般人难于想像的。他对于思维科学和系统科学的倡导和建设，对于科学与艺术相结合理念的提出，都是革命性的创新思想，在这个意义上，说他同时也是一位思想家，并不过分。

 
 

我相信，我的这些看法，被一些媒体采用了。但遗憾的是，这些话，我没有机会说给钱先生本人听。

 

 

                                              

  2022,1,16

 作者李昕，曾任职人民文学出版社、香港三联书店和北京生活、读书、新知三联书店。本文刊于《长江文艺》2022年第5期。

title: O que são NFTs?
body:
## Definição

A tecnologia dos NFTs, **Non-Fungible Tokens**, foi creada em 2017 através de contratos inteligentes na blockchain Ethereum. No início de 2021, os NFTs entram de repente em destaque no mundo das criptomoedas e tecnologia subjacente (blockchain).

Um NFT é um tipo de token. **Mas o que são tokens?**

**Tokens** são unidades virtuais que confirmam a posse de certo activo digital. Os tokens operam com base na tecnologia blockchain, aquela que está na base das criptomoedas. Para entender melhor os conceitos **blockchain** e **criptomoeda**, recomendo a leitura deste artigo:

[https://mirror.xyz/0x2DBF911D78815D995B05bc8FA42e378f78D7CC7b/0vQjECsvCIYUAkSbXuKWo3Jncbsg3ZiaaS0-2fraLnQ](https://mirror.xyz/0x2DBF911D78815D995B05bc8FA42e378f78D7CC7b/0vQjECsvCIYUAkSbXuKWo3Jncbsg3ZiaaS0-2fraLnQ)

Entre todos os tokens existentes (mais de 13 000 neste momento - o site [Coingecko](https://www.coingecko.com/) chama-os todos de ‘Coins’, mas na realidade só alguns são moedas) há alguns que se chamam moedas. Uma moeda, ou criptomoeda, é semelhante a uma moeda física, e é um token nativo de certa blockchain. Cada blockchain só tem uma moeda, mas pode ter vários tokens. As moedas tipicamente têm o mesmo nome da blockchain onde operam. Por exemplo, [SOLANA](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/solana) (SOL) é a moeda da blockchain Solana, e [SOLCIAL](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/solcial) (SLCL) é um token que opera nessa mesma blockchain. Por exemplo, [ETHEREUM ou ETHER](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/ethereum) (ETH) é a moeda da blockchain Ethereum, e [BASIC ATTENTION TOKEN](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/basic-attention-token) (BAT) é um token que opera nessa mesma blockchain. Note-se que tokens que não sejam nativos, i.e não sejam moedas, podem existir em várias blockchains, como é o caso do BAT (tal facto está indicado no campo ‘Contract’, menu **…**, em **Info** - ver link acima).

Os portadores de tokens podem, além de os guardar nas suas carteiras digitais, trocá-los por outros tokens em casas de cambio online, vendê-los (NFTs) em *marketplaces*, oferecê-los, ou usá-los para comprar algo. Existem vários tipos de tokens, entre os quais destaco:

* **Pagamento** – usado para efectuar transações financeiras no mundo digital (moedas como Solana, Cardano, Bitcoin, Ethereum).
* **Utilitário** – usado para dar acesso a produtos ou serviços baseados em alguma blockchain.

  Todos os tipos anteriores são **fungíveis** (*fungible tokens*), ou seja, podem ser trocados por algo de valor igual – 1 Bitcoin na mão da pessoa A vale o mesmo que 1 Bitcoin na mão da pessoa B, ou seja, se as pessoas trocarem as moedas o cenário não se altera. Tal não se passa com os NFTs, pois cada um é único. Diz-se por isso que são **não-fungíveis**.
* **NFT** – certificados digitais únicos de trabalhos originais, onde o criador original terá sempre controlo sobre a forma como o trabalho é licensiado. São compostos por vários elementos, tais como:
  * **conteúdo digital** que representa – ficheiro de imagem, audio, texto, ou vídeo (normalmente guardado de forma descentralizada fora da blockchain, juntamente com alguns metadados, e.g na rede **IPFS**).
  * **criador** – identificação do criador do token.
  * **proprietário** – identificação do actual proprietário do token, o qual será ainda o criador se o token não tiver sido oferecido ou vendido.
  * **preço ou ofertas**, caso esteja à venda ou em leilão.
  * **outros metadados** – informações sobre o activo digital, como assinatura do criador, descrição, tipo de ficheiro, resolução, histórico de transações, data e hora da sua criação, …

Outra diferença entre **NFTs** e tokens fungíveis (como moedas, por exemplo) é a **indivisibilidade** dos primeiros. Por exemplo, poderás enviar 0.05 Bitcoins a um amigo, mas não poderás fazer o mesmo com 5% de um NFT.

## Valor

Se todos os criadores digitais publicarem os seus novos trabalhos, originais, como NFT, todo aquele que tentar copiar o seu trabalho e certificá-lo como NFT, muito dificilmente terá o seu trabalho reconhecido como original. Isto porque existem mecanismos (e cada vez existirão mais) para saber se certo conteúdo digital já foi publicado mais que uma vez na web como NFT (e.g, vários marketplaces fazem essa fiscalização, em breve existirão **motores de busca de NFTs** – ver websites em baixo, e poderás usar o [motor de busca da Google](https://images.google.com/) para saber a localização de certo ficheiro de imagem).

[https://nftsearch.site/](https://nftsearch.site/)

**Nota**: *se ainda não existir na base de dados, deverás/poderás adicionar o NFT que procuras à mesma*.

[https://hebys.io/](https://hebys.io/)

[https://nftlab.com/](https://nftlab.com/)

[https://nooft.io/](https://nooft.io/)

Regra geral, é possível salvar ou copiar o conteúdo digital de um NFT, seja uma imagem, vídeo, áudio ou documento, mas nunca será possível copiar o NFT. Esse terá sempre um único proprietário. Uma pessoa que crie um NFT com base na cópia  (ficheiro, screenshot) do conteúdo digital de outro NFT, terá sempre em sua posse um NFT distinto, publicado em data posterior à do original.

> *Markets for traditional art and collectibles are thriving despite forgeries, and the issue is even smaller with NFTs* ([ref](https://archive.ph/ptRTw))

Os NFTs podem ser programados para permitir ao criador/autor arrecadar dinheiro sempre que o NFT for vendido, normalmente entre 2.5% a 10% do preço de venda.

## Como Criar e Comercializar?

Qualquer pessoa pode criar algo digitalmente, transformá-lo num NFT em alguma blockchain (processo chamado ‘Minting’ em Inglês), e colocar esse token para venda em algum *marketplace* online. Alguns locais cobram para publiar os teus NFTs. Qualquer marketplace cobra uma taxa do valor de venda de cada NFT, a qual poderá ser suportada pelo comprador ou pelo vendedor, dependendo da plataforma.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GGvxJ9xOJMs4wmx6mBN0S.png?height=530&width=1127)

De modo a poderes comprar um NFT, precisarás de dispor na tua carteira digital da criptomoeda associada à blockchain onde o token está alojado.

### Marketplaces

Neste momento, os seguintes 3 mercados permitem-te criar e vender NFTs de forma gratuita:

* **Rarible** ([ref](https://archive.ph/Qd8Oa))
* **Mintable**
* [OpenSea](https://opensea.io/)

Apps que sigo:

[https://rarible.com/](https://rarible.com/)

[https://apollo42.app/](https://apollo42.app/)

[https://galacticway.io/](https://galacticway.io/)

[https://zora.co/](https://zora.co/)

[https://solsea.io/](https://solsea.io/)

[https://mintable.app/](https://mintable.app/)

title: Solidity 课程 10: 继承
这是婚姻中最重要的能力，却常常被忽视
body:
好友Lisa离婚了。我的心情有些复杂。和她相识多年，她的情况我多少知道一些。她的家，是一个冰冷和暴风骤雨交替存在的世界。她和她的丈夫，不是处在冷战中，就是处在冷战后可怕的暴风雨中。

那种冷，那种暴风雨，真的可以在短时间内摧毁任何两个身处其中的人，哪怕他们曾经是多么的相爱。

她和他之间，似乎隔了一堵厚厚的墙。那堵墙看不见，摸不着，然而它却是那么强大，让墙那头的他看不见她，也让墙这边的她听不到他。于是，墙变得越来越高、越来越厚，两人的关系也越来越淡、越走越远，分手几乎成为必然。

现实中，在我们每个人的婚姻关系中，这堵墙也很普遍地存在着。它蒙蔽了我们的心，遮住了我们的眼睛，也阻隔了我们的爱。其实，我们有很多人，在这堵墙的作用下，集体“失明”了。

**01有时候，我们最难做到的，就是“看见”**

有一部很老的香港影片《异度空间》，可能很多人还有印象。我相信这绝对不是一部恐怖片，而是一部帮助我们探索心灵的好电影。

第一次看，是在中学时代。当时班级组织同学们集体观看。集体的气氛，大大削弱了影片中一些惊悚的音乐和镜头带给人的恐惧感。

张国荣扮演的心理医生，始终无法走出初恋女友自杀这个事件的阴影，虽然他极力克制自己的感情，甚至不惜采用一些极端的“治疗手段”去强迫自己遗忘这段记忆。

然而，那段过往、那段记忆并没有真的消失，而是以另一种方式潜伏在了他的脑海中。每到夜晚，这段痛苦的、可怕的记忆就跑出来折磨他。

他问那个看不见的“鬼魂”：为什么你那么狠毒，为什么你死了还要跟着我……

他看着一堆他和初恋女友过去留下的照片、信件，喃喃自语：为什么我明明全部丢掉了，它们还在这里……

那是因为，在他心底，他从未忘记过这段感情，也从未放下过他的初恋女友。他的孤独，他的恐惧，他的痛苦，都来自他深深的内疚、自责、悔恨。并不是已去世的初恋女友不肯放过他，而是他自己不肯放过自己。

他抗拒外界的担忧、关心、帮助。他宁愿把自己锁在那个自以为安全的自我封闭的小盒子里，永远都不要出来。

然而，他的痛苦和恐惧却并没有减少、反而与日俱增。

当他终于承认自己的恐惧和无助，紧紧抱住林嘉欣，说“请你帮帮我、帮帮我”的时候，他便打开了自己，有机会“看见”他真正恐惧的东西。

于是，他“看见”了那个他极力回避、极力去遗忘的已自杀的初恋女友。她的面目是那样狰狞、那样可怕。她的幽灵无处不在，而四处逃窜的他，终于无处可逃。

当他“站在”初恋女友跳楼自杀的那个平台，逃无可逃的那一刻，他回过头，面对那张狰狞可怕的脸，他终于可以面对曾经爱的那个女孩，终于可以跟她说说自己最想对她说的话。

他说，我知道我该怎么做了，你要我跳下去，你想要我死。不过我想告诉你，一直以来我都没有开心过，一直以来我都无法接受别的女孩子，是因为你。你死了那么久都没有开心，我又有什么权利去开心？

其实我很想忘记你，我真的很想忘记你。如果我死了可以满足你，令你开心，我会做！你以为我下去之后，你就可以忘记以往不快的事吗，有些东西破碎了就是破碎了，怎么都不能补救，我们大家都不会忘记，永远都不会忘记……

他痛哭流涕地说着。他对面那个狰狞的、可怕的初恋女友哭了。她一步步走过来，看着他，抚摸着他的脸。而那张可怕的脸，在慢慢变化，最终变回中学时代那张清纯美丽的脸。最后，一个清纯甜美的声音对他说：我已经不再爱你了。而她的身影，也消失不见了。

记得当时看到这个场景时，同学们有的在惊叫，有的在唏嘘，但是当时的我们可能并没有完全领会影片的含义，而黑暗中的我们已经泪流满面。直至今日，再回想这个画面，依旧想哭。

有时候，我们最难做到的，就是“看见”——看见自己的内心，看见对方的悲伤、渴望和期待。

当“初恋女友”被他真正“看见”的一刻，她便原谅了他；当他真正“看见”自己内心的那一刻，“鬼魂”便永远离开了他。其实，那个扰得他日夜不宁的“鬼魂”不是他的初恋女友，而是他内心无法释怀的心结。

爱，才是真正的救赎

多年后，一部网络剧《摆渡人》中的一个故事“红衣学姐”，情节和主题和《异度空间》几乎如出一辙。

故事中，在多年之前，“红衣学姐”吕红曾与学校里的胡教授是恋人，但这段师生之恋却不为当时所知。当年的胡教授迫于各种压力对恋人吕红遭遇的种种责难保持了沉默，最终导致吕红跳楼身亡，并化为厉鬼滞留于404宿舍，引发了后来得多起校园自杀事件。多年来，胡教授对此事耿耿于怀，像积压在胸口的一块石头，压得他喘不过气来。最终，胡教授在危急关头替红衣学姐挡下了一颗子弹，用真情化解了红衣学姐的怨念。

那一刻，红衣学姐从一个可怕的“厉鬼”，重新变回了善良美丽的吕红，而宿舍凶灵事件也终于得以化解，学校重归安宁。

看到“厉鬼”变身为温柔美丽的真人吕红的时候，不禁又让人落泪。因为，厉鬼并不是她真实的模样，她是被怨恨和积念所深深缠绕，才变成那个殃及他人、又让自己痛苦的厉鬼模样。而当她被胡教授“看见”的时候，当她被爱所关照的时候，她便释然、便放下了积怨和仇恨、变回了真正的自己。

而胡教授，当他“看见”自己的懦弱、悔恨和昔日恋人的委屈、冤屈的时候 ，他也得到了救赎，“厉鬼”也远离了他。

03我自深渊向你哭喊，希望你能看到我……

现实中，那些日渐唠叨、在丈夫眼中变得“不可理喻”的女人们，那些歇斯底里、快要失去理智的妻子们，她们其实是在呼唤，在呐喊，呼唤丈夫们的倾听，呼唤那份丢失的爱。

丈夫们，此时，你是否能看到你的妻子，看到她的日益操劳，看到她那份对家深深的眷恋；看到她歇斯底里背后其实只是想要一句温暖的话、一个关怀的眼神、一个踏实的拥抱；看到她眼角浮起皱纹的脸庞下，依旧有一颗渴望爱情和天长地久的女人心。

女人的心，终究是柔软的。当她们被看见的时候，当她们敏感地感知到“爱”的时候，她们内心的委屈、怨念便会顷刻间化解。就像《异度空间》和《红衣学姐》里面，她们会变回最初的她。

一对对相爱的恋人、夫妻，当他们怒目以对、相互咆哮、歇斯底里的时候，或许他/她正在向对方呐喊：我自深渊向你哭喊，希望你能看到我……

**04黑暗中没有别人，只有你自己**

至此，我想到一个寓言故事：

从前有个人，他一直被一个可怕的怪兽追赶，他从来都不敢直视怪兽，每次当怪兽远远地向他逼来时，他都没命地逃跑，头也不回。

有一天夜里，他再次被怪兽追赶，这次他选择了一条之前没有跑过的路，想要甩开怪兽。可是很快他便发现自己跑到了一个悬崖边，再往前一步，就是万丈深渊。这个时候，他仿佛都能感觉到怪兽在他背后的鼻息。他，终于无路可退了。

他想：死也该死个明白吧！于是，他决定在死之前，转身看看那个一直在追赶他，逼得他走投无路的怪兽。在那一刹那，他甚至觉得自己可以鼓起勇气，问问怪兽：你为什么要追杀我？

他深呼了一口气，然后转身直面一直追赶他的怪兽。然后，他惊呆了：原来怪兽就是他自己，一个在阴影中，一直不被他看到的自己。

他还是决定问问另一个自己，于是他说：“你为什么一直在追赶我？这么久以来，因为你的存在，你知道我做了多少个噩梦，惊醒了多少次，没命地奔跑过多少回吗？”

“怪兽”无辜地看着他说：“其实，其实我只是希望你能回过头来看看我……”

无独有偶。武志红也提到过一个案例：

一位来访者，当他单独在家的时候，总觉得小偷进来了，这个小偷就在他身边巡视，令他恐惧不已。于是咨询师鼓励这位来访者鼓起勇气看着这个“小偷”，并感谢他，欢迎他的到来。然后问来访者，如果这个小偷对你说话，他说了什么。

结果来访者想了想回答说，小偷告诉他：“我不是来伤害你的，我是来陪伴你的”。讲完这句话，来访者嚎啕大哭。原来，来访者的童年，也常处于孤单中。这种孤单对于小孩子来说是很可怕的。于是，他创造了一个小偷意向，来吓唬自己，因为恐惧的感觉虽然很不好，但总好过孤单。

就像生活中，当我们痛苦、悲伤、感觉无力的时候，有时会对我们的伴侣抱怨、指责、愤怒、不满，其实我们只是想寻求对方的关注、理解和支持。

据科学研究发现，委屈、悲伤的情绪是人类最强烈的情绪，甚至高于愤怒的情绪。人都有自我保护机制，所以，很多时候，当我们悲伤到一定程度，便会通过愤怒的形式表现出来。

所以，下次当你看到伴侣对你表达愤怒的时候，很可能是他/她遇到了伤心或委屈，而你并没有看到，也没有去理解。

我们常常说一段关系需要用心经营才能长久，这没有错。然而经营的前提是真正“看见”并懂得对方。

愿你我都能保持一双孩童般清澈明净的眼睛，保持“看见”对方的能力，看见对方的脆弱、悲伤、期待、渴望；愿你我都保持一颗柔软宽厚的心，去感受、去觉察自我和他人的内心。因为，“看见”本身，就是爱。

title: Blockchain allows for user-aligned metrics (/memo)
body:
> ### Since the boom of search engines, the internet has the wrong incentives - pushing content creators and media to design content for clicks and pageviews.

The birth of the internet brought with it a new way for content creators to measure their impact on audiences. With search engines upon which anyone can post articles and other media, there is an exact metric for how many people have viewed each piece of content. This system has its pros and cons, but one of the biggest drawbacks is that it incentivizes clickbait titles. Since we now know exactly how much money per click we can make if our title is optimized correctly, all outlets have been forced to alter their titles in order to attract more views from users who are looking for specific keywords or phrases (or simply just want a quick laugh).

### Through analytic platforms, you can see the results of your latest promotional action with a cost effect relation.

As the web2 era has progressed, businesses have had to optimize for clickbait and quality content. Instead of focusing on generating high quality content with good information for users, businesses are incentivized to create low-quality content that sucks up as much time as possible (in order to maximize advertisement revenue).

This is a negative sum game because both sides lose out: the advertiser loses out because they're paying more money for lower value ads; the publisher loses out because they're getting less money from their skills.

## But now with crypto, we can see the effect that it has on its readers, thanks to the open state of the blockchain.

But now with crypto, we can see the effect that it has on its readers, thanks to the open state of the blockchain.

Cryptocurrencies are distributed in a way that makes them impossible to tamper with and gives users full control over their funds. This may sound like a dangerous scenario at first, but it actually allows individuals to know exactly how much money they’re making when they use a cryptocurrency-powered website or app. With traditional payment systems like PayPal and Stripe, there is no way for users to know how much money they are being paid unless they go through an arduous audit process (which rarely happens).

This is a simple **concept that is also deep, it's a use case that was not doable before crypto given that you couldn't get provable** user-aligned metrics.

The thing about blockchain is that you can quantify the benefit of the content for the user in terms of time spent, engagement and value they generated with their time on your platform — all in real time, as they are consuming it.

Let's take Steemit as an example because it has been around longer than most platforms out there and has proven this concept works: The more upvotes users receive on their posts, the more upvotes they earn which means the more money they get paid (if they choose to accept payment via Steemit). This incentivizes them to not only create great content but also promote themselves so more people will see what great work they do!

### This means that we can now judge content in a completely different way, not just whether it makes money for BuzzFeed but whether it makes money for you.

The most exciting thing about user-aligned metrics is that they can be used to measure the value of any given piece of content and provide a clear picture of what really drives people to engage with it. This means that we can now judge content in a completely different way, not just whether it makes money for BuzzFeed but whether it makes money for you.

For example: if you're a travel blogger, this will allow you to create more personalized content as well as measure its success based on how much money it generates for your business. Instead of looking at page views or clicks (which were always tricky), user-aligned metrics give us real numbers about how much revenue each piece of content generates relative to other authors or other topics within your industry. You can then use this information to make better decisions about what kind of posts should go up next month—and which ones should never see the light again!

### Blockchain technology may be able to help us create a consumption-driven internet. It's a total shift from the web2.0 era and it's user aligned.

The web2.0 era was a time when metrics were king. Sites were measured by how many clicks they got and what their bounce rate was. But this metric wasn’t necessarily good for users; it was only good for the site owner because they could use it to show advertisers how popular their content was, which they could then use as leverage to get more money out of them.

We're now entering a new phase in the web where we can measure things differently, thanks to blockchain technology and user-aligned metrics that reflect what people actually want rather than just what benefits the site owner or advertiser.

title: O que são NFTs?
body:
## Definição

A tecnologia dos NFTs, **Non-Fungible Tokens**, foi creada em 2017 através de contratos inteligentes na blockchain Ethereum. No início de 2021, os NFTs entram de repente em destaque no mundo das criptomoedas e tecnologia subjacente (blockchain).

Um NFT é um tipo de token. **Mas o que são tokens?**

**Tokens** são unidades virtuais que confirmam a posse de certo activo digital. Os tokens operam com base na tecnologia blockchain, aquela que está na base das criptomoedas. Para entender melhor os conceitos **blockchain** e **criptomoeda**, recomendo a leitura deste artigo:

[https://mirror.xyz/0x2DBF911D78815D995B05bc8FA42e378f78D7CC7b/0vQjECsvCIYUAkSbXuKWo3Jncbsg3ZiaaS0-2fraLnQ](https://mirror.xyz/0x2DBF911D78815D995B05bc8FA42e378f78D7CC7b/0vQjECsvCIYUAkSbXuKWo3Jncbsg3ZiaaS0-2fraLnQ)

Entre todos os tokens existentes (mais de 13 000 neste momento - o site [Coingecko](https://www.coingecko.com/) chama-os todos de ‘Coins’, mas na realidade só alguns são moedas) há alguns que se chamam moedas. Uma moeda, ou criptomoeda, é semelhante a uma moeda física, e é um token nativo de certa blockchain. Cada blockchain só tem uma moeda, mas pode ter vários tokens. As moedas tipicamente têm o mesmo nome da blockchain onde operam. Por exemplo, [SOLANA](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/solana) (SOL) é a moeda da blockchain Solana, e [SOLCIAL](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/solcial) (SLCL) é um token que opera nessa mesma blockchain. Por exemplo, [ETHEREUM ou ETHER](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/ethereum) (ETH) é a moeda da blockchain Ethereum, e [BASIC ATTENTION TOKEN](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/basic-attention-token) (BAT) é um token que opera nessa mesma blockchain. Note-se que tokens que não sejam nativos, i.e não sejam moedas, podem existir em várias blockchains, como é o caso do BAT (tal facto está indicado no campo ‘Contract’, menu **…**, em **Info** - ver link acima).

Os portadores de tokens podem, além de os guardar nas suas carteiras digitais, trocá-los por outros tokens em casas de cambio online, vendê-los (NFTs) em *marketplaces*, oferecê-los, ou usá-los para comprar algo. Existem vários tipos de tokens, entre os quais destaco:

* **Pagamento** – usado para efectuar transações financeiras no mundo digital (moedas como Solana, Cardano, Bitcoin, Ethereum).
* **Utilitário** – usado para dar acesso a produtos ou serviços baseados em alguma blockchain.

  Todos os tipos anteriores são **fungíveis** (*fungible tokens*), ou seja, podem ser trocados por algo de valor igual – 1 Bitcoin na mão da pessoa A vale o mesmo que 1 Bitcoin na mão da pessoa B, ou seja, se as pessoas trocarem as moedas o cenário não se altera. Tal não se passa com os NFTs, pois cada um é único. Diz-se por isso que são **não-fungíveis**.
* **NFT** – certificados digitais únicos de trabalhos originais, onde o criador original terá sempre controlo sobre a forma como o trabalho é licensiado. São compostos por vários elementos, tais como:
  * **conteúdo digital** que representa – ficheiro de imagem, audio, texto, ou vídeo (normalmente guardado de forma descentralizada fora da blockchain, juntamente com alguns metadados, e.g na rede IPFS).
  * **criador** – identificação do criador do token.
  * **proprietário** – identificação do actual proprietário do token, o qual será ainda o criador se o token não tiver sido oferecido ou vendido.
  * **preço ou ofertas**, caso esteja à venda ou em leilão.
  * **outros metadados** – informações sobre o activo digital, como assinatura do criador, descrição, tipo de ficheiro, resolução, histórico de transações, data e hora da sua criação, …

Outra diferença entre **NFTs** e tokens fungíveis (como moedas, por exemplo) é a **indivisibilidade** dos primeiros. Por exemplo, poderás enviar 0.05 Bitcoins a um amigo, mas não poderás fazer o mesmo com 5% de um NFT.

## Valor

Se todos os criadores digitais publicarem os seus novos trabalhos, originais, como NFT, todo aquele que tentar copiar o seu trabalho e certificá-lo como NFT, muito dificilmente terá o seu trabalho reconhecido como original. Isto porque existem mecanismos (e cada vez existirão mais) para saber se certo conteúdo digital já foi publicado mais que uma vez na web como NFT (e.g, vários marketplaces fazem essa fiscalização, em breve existirão **motores de busca de NFTs** – ver websites em baixo, e poderás usar o [motor de busca da Google](https://images.google.com/) para saber a localização de certo ficheiro de imagem).

[https://nftsearch.site/](https://nftsearch.site/)

**Nota**: *se ainda não existir na base de dados, deverás/poderás adicionar o NFT que procuras à mesma*.

[https://hebys.io/](https://hebys.io/)

[https://nftlab.com/](https://nftlab.com/)

[https://nooft.io/](https://nooft.io/)

Regra geral, é possível salvar ou copiar o conteúdo digital de um NFT, seja uma imagem, vídeo, áudio ou documento, mas nunca será possível copiar o NFT. Esse terá sempre um único proprietário. Uma pessoa que crie um NFT com base na cópia  (ficheiro, screenshot) do conteúdo digital de outro NFT, terá sempre em sua posse um NFT distinto, publicado em data posterior à do original.

> *Markets for traditional art and collectibles are thriving despite forgeries, and the issue is even smaller with NFTs* ([ref](https://archive.ph/ptRTw))

Os NFTs podem ser programados para permitir ao criador/autor arrecadar dinheiro sempre que o NFT for vendido, normalmente entre 2.5% a 10% do preço de venda.

## Como Criar e Comercializar?

Qualquer pessoa pode criar algo digitalmente, transformá-lo num NFT em alguma blockchain (processo chamado ‘Minting’ em Inglês), e colocar esse token para venda em algum *marketplace* online. Alguns locais cobram para publiar os teus NFTs. Qualquer marketplace cobra uma taxa do valor de venda de cada NFT, a qual poderá ser suportada pelo comprador ou pelo vendedor, dependendo da plataforma.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GGvxJ9xOJMs4wmx6mBN0S.png?height=530&width=1127)

De modo a poderes comprar um NFT, precisarás de dispor na tua carteira digital da criptomoeda associada à blockchain onde o token está alojado.

### Marketplaces

Neste momento, os seguintes 3 mercados permitem-te criar e vender NFTs de forma gratuita:

* **Rarible** ([ref](https://archive.ph/Qd8Oa))
* **Mintable**
* [OpenSea](https://opensea.io/)

Apps que sigo:

[https://rarible.com/](https://rarible.com/)

[https://apollo42.app/](https://apollo42.app/)

[https://galacticway.io/](https://galacticway.io/)

[https://zora.co/](https://zora.co/)

[https://solsea.io/](https://solsea.io/)

[https://mintable.app/](https://mintable.app/)

## Referências

[https://archive.ph/NlxxB](https://archive.ph/NlxxB)

[https://archive.ph/oKR8W](https://archive.ph/oKR8W)

[https://archive.ph/AWjJO](https://archive.ph/AWjJO)

[https://archive.ph/vKltQ](https://archive.ph/vKltQ)

[https://archive.ph/BYYKv](https://archive.ph/BYYKv)

[https://archive.ph/xvBDn](https://archive.ph/xvBDn)

[https://archive.ph/C4Sbu](https://archive.ph/C4Sbu)

[https://archive.ph/1hOCp](https://archive.ph/1hOCp)

[https://archive.ph/Z4UkZ](https://archive.ph/Z4UkZ)

[https://archive.ph/pIeKl](https://archive.ph/pIeKl)

[https://archive.ph/O7zOR](https://archive.ph/O7zOR)

[https://archive.ph/3gqjg](https://archive.ph/3gqjg)

  * **conteúdo digital** que representa – ficheiro de imagem, audio, texto, ou vídeo (normalmente guardado de forma descentralizada fora da blockchain - e.g, IPFS).
  * **criador** – identificação do criador do token.
  * **proprietário** – identificação do actual proprietário do token, o qual será ainda o criador se o token não tiver sido oferecido ou vendido.
  * **preço ou ofertas**, caso esteja à venda ou em leilão.
  * **outros metadados** – informações sobre o activo digital, como assinatura do criador, descrição, tipo de ficheiro, resolução, histórico de transações, data e hora da sua criação, …

Outra diferença entre **NFTs** e tokens fungíveis (como moedas, por exemplo) é a **indivisibilidade** dos primeiros. Por exemplo, poderás enviar 0.05 Bitcoins a um amigo, mas não poderás fazer o mesmo com 5% de um NFT.

## Valor

Se todos os criadores digitais publicarem os seus novos trabalhos, originais, como NFT, todo aquele que tentar copiar o seu trabalho e certificá-lo como NFT, muito dificilmente terá o seu trabalho reconhecido como original. Isto porque existem mecanismos (e cada vez existirão mais) para saber se certo conteúdo digital já foi publicado mais que uma vez na web como NFT (e.g, vários marketplaces fazem essa fiscalização, em breve existirão **motores de busca de NFTs** – ver websites em baixo, e poderás usar o [motor de busca da Google](https://images.google.com/) para saber a localização de certo ficheiro de imagem).

[https://nftsearch.site/](https://nftsearch.site/)

**Nota**: *se ainda não existir na base de dados, deverás/poderás adicionar o NFT que procuras à mesma*.

[https://hebys.io/](https://hebys.io/)

[https://nftlab.com/](https://nftlab.com/)

[https://nooft.io/](https://nooft.io/)

Regra geral, é possível salvar ou copiar o conteúdo digital de um NFT, seja uma imagem, vídeo, áudio ou documento, mas nunca será possível copiar o NFT. Esse terá sempre um único proprietário. Uma pessoa que crie um NFT com base na cópia  (ficheiro, screenshot) do conteúdo digital de outro NFT, terá sempre em sua posse um NFT distinto, publicado em data posterior à do original.

> *Markets for traditional art and collectibles are thriving despite forgeries, and the issue is even smaller with NFTs* ([ref](https://archive.ph/ptRTw))

Os NFTs podem ser programados para permitir ao criador/autor arrecadar dinheiro sempre que o NFT for vendido, normalmente entre 2.5% a 10% do preço de venda.

## Como Criar e Comercializar?

Qualquer pessoa pode criar algo digitalmente, transformá-lo num NFT em alguma blockchain (processo chamado ‘Minting’ em Inglês), e colocar esse token para venda em algum *marketplace* online. Alguns locais cobram para publiar os teus NFTs. Qualquer marketplace cobra uma taxa do valor de venda de cada NFT, a qual poderá ser suportada pelo comprador ou pelo vendedor, dependendo da plataforma.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GGvxJ9xOJMs4wmx6mBN0S.png?height=530&width=1127)

De modo a poderes comprar um NFT, precisarás de dispor na tua carteira digital da criptomoeda associada à blockchain onde o token está alojado.

title: O que são NFTs?
body:
## Definição

A tecnologia dos NFTs, **Non-Fungible Tokens**, foi creada em 2017 através de contratos inteligentes na blockchain Ethereum. No início de 2021, os NFTs entram de repente em destaque no mundo das criptomoedas e tecnologia subjacente (blockchain).

Um NFT é um tipo de token. **Mas o que são tokens?**

**Tokens** são unidades virtuais que confirmam a posse de certo activo digital. Os tokens operam com base na tecnologia blockchain, aquela que está na base das criptomoedas. Para entender melhor os conceitos **blockchain** e **criptomoeda**, recomendo a leitura deste artigo:

[https://mirror.xyz/0x2DBF911D78815D995B05bc8FA42e378f78D7CC7b/0vQjECsvCIYUAkSbXuKWo3Jncbsg3ZiaaS0-2fraLnQ](https://mirror.xyz/0x2DBF911D78815D995B05bc8FA42e378f78D7CC7b/0vQjECsvCIYUAkSbXuKWo3Jncbsg3ZiaaS0-2fraLnQ)

Entre todos os tokens existentes (mais de 13 000 neste momento - o site [Coingecko](https://www.coingecko.com/) chama-os todos de ‘Coins’, mas na realidade só alguns são moedas) há alguns que se chamam moedas. Uma moeda, ou criptomoeda, é semelhante a uma moeda física, e é um token nativo de certa blockchain. Cada blockchain só tem uma moeda, mas pode ter vários tokens. As moedas tipicamente têm o mesmo nome da blockchain onde operam. Por exemplo, [SOLANA](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/solana) (SOL) é a moeda da blockchain Solana, e [SOLCIAL](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/solcial) (SLCL) é um token que opera nessa mesma blockchain. Por exemplo, [ETHEREUM ou ETHER](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/ethereum) (ETH) é a moeda da blockchain Ethereum, e [BASIC ATTENTION TOKEN](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/basic-attention-token) (BAT) é um token que opera nessa mesma blockchain. Note-se que tokens que não sejam nativos, i.e não sejam moedas, podem existir em várias blockchains, como é o caso do BAT (tal facto está indicado no campo ‘Contract’, menu **…**, em **Info** - ver link acima).

Os portadores de tokens podem, além de os guardar nas suas carteiras digitais, trocá-los por outros tokens em casas de cambio online, vendê-los (NFTs) em *marketplaces*, oferecê-los, ou usá-los para comprar algo. Existem vários tipos de tokens, entre os quais destaco:

* **Pagamento** – usado para efectuar transações financeiras no mundo digital (moedas como Solana, Cardano, Bitcoin, Ethereum).
* **Utilitário** – usado para dar acesso a produtos ou serviços baseados em alguma blockchain.

  Todos os tipos anteriores são **fungíveis** (*fungible tokens*), ou seja, podem ser trocados por algo de valor igual – 1 Bitcoin na mão da pessoa A vale o mesmo que 1 Bitcoin na mão da pessoa B, ou seja, se as pessoas trocarem as moedas o cenário não se altera. Tal não se passa com os NFTs, pois cada um é único. Diz-se por isso que são **não-fungíveis**.
* **NFT** – certificados digitais únicos de trabalhos originais, onde o criador original terá sempre controlo sobre a forma como o trabalho é licensiado. São compostos por vários elementos, tais como:
  * **conteúdo digital** que representa – ficheiro de imagem, audio, texto, ou vídeo (normalmente guardado de forma descentralizada fora da blockchain, juntamente com alguns metadados, e.g na rede IPFS).

  * **proprietário** – identificação do actual proprietário do token, o qual será ainda o criador se o token não tiver sido oferecido ou vendido.

  * **outros metadados** – informações sobre o activo digital, como assinatura do criador, descrição, tipo de ficheiro, resolução, histórico de transações, data e hora da sua criação, …

Outra diferença entre **NFTs** e tokens fungíveis (como moedas, por exemplo) é a **indivisibilidade** dos primeiros. Por exemplo, poderás enviar 0.05 Bitcoins a um amigo, mas não poderás fazer o mesmo com 5% de um NFT.

title: 电影里的绿，也是一场治愈
body:
绿色，我们聊过太多了，这几年再没有哪个颜色能和绿色拼流量，比话题热度，人们的衣橱里拥有了更多绿色单品，越是贴近越是更感受到它的美好。

 
 

 
  
 

　　我们对绿色的渴望也从未达到如此巅峰，一次与大自然亲密无间的露营，一场置身于天然氧吧中的漫步，看到枯枝发起了嫩绿的新芽，碧波在清风徐徐中荡漾，都能让人感受到安宁与平和的美，由衷地微微泛起笑意。

 
 

 
  
 

　　我们在绿意里看到了生命力，看到了跃动的活力，看到万物生长，不知从哪儿来的力量便一扫心中阴霾，要像绿色那样去向阳而生。人世间值得啊\~

 
 

 
  
 

　　很多导演也把绿色用在了自己的作品中，特别是用在女主角的服装造型中，往往给观众带来非常深刻的印象。

　　

　　例如常常会提起法国侯麦导演的作品，《春天的故事》中绿色爬满墙角，跳落在花瓶里。

 
 

 
  
  
  
 

　　当然，也在娜塔莎身上，强烈的墨绿色纯色上衣，搭配着高腰牛仔裤或短外套，这又酷又飒的复古穿搭在当下又回潮了。

 
 

 
  
  
  
 

　　侯麦电影《女友的男友》中的蓝配绿也是相当经典，就像剧中男男女女的关系那样错置，互为邻近色，你中有我我中有你，说不清道不明，互为纠缠。

 
 

 
  
 

　　色彩不是极致的浓烈，也不是不着痕迹的清浅，这个中间位置方令人充满遐想。

 
 

 
  
  
  
 

　　在《布鲁克林》里，绿色是心之所向，一个少女对青春的迷茫，让绿色一直呈现各种变化。

 
 

 
  
  
  
 

　　是大洋彼岸不确定的美好，还是家乡平淡的温存，Eilis的挣扎，是每一个在家乡与远方之间徘徊的人最深刻的感受，如果都好、都不好，那无需选择，都有好、都有不好，才难。

 
 

 
  
  
  
 

　　本色出演爱尔兰女孩儿的西尔莎·罗南，让这个人物从小镇姑娘变成了时髦自信的纽约女郎，各种色调的绿色也随着人物的内核在变化。

 
 

 
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

　　剧中的情侣装，都让人忍不住想多看几眼，互为配色搭配得太好了。

 
 

 
  
  
  
 

　　格温妮斯·帕特洛在电影《远大前程》中的绿色套装也让人过目难忘，当然不仅仅是因为这一身绿色的亮眼，也因为她极尽挑逗的穿法。

 
 

 
  
 

　　女主的绿色裙装更是穿越了时空，在那支舞蹈的旋转中，时光已匆匆。不变的是，一直都是那高傲与冷酷的绿。

 
 

 
  
  
  
 

　　古早大片《乱世佳人》中，费雯·丽那一袭天鹅绒窗帘制成的绿裙是必谈的经典。

 
 

 
  
 

　　剧中的绿色礼服其实还有不少，俏皮清新的绿，浓墨重彩的绿，都描绘着这个乱世浮生中猫一样的女人，身上那些刚强、坚韧、虚荣、贪婪、残忍还有自私。

 
 

 
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

　　如果要说经典，很多人一定会把这条裙子排在前三，《赎罪》里凯特·奈特莉出席晚宴身穿的艳绿色长裙，它让很多人说“我以前本来不穿绿色的”。

 
 

 
  
  
  
 

　　《另一个波琳家的女孩》里娜塔丽·波特曼的绿裙也同样拥有着极高的饱和度，充满野心和欲望，只有光辉灿烂的日子，她才会这么穿。

 
 

 
  
 

　　安妮·海瑟薇早年在《穿普拉达的女王》中也是以一身翠绿色长外套实现职场华丽变身。

 
 

 
  
 

　　虽然都叫绿色，却美得各不相同。即便在她们身上只是一抹单一的颜色，也让人一眼看穿角色的命运。

 
 

 
 

　　如果你还没喜欢上绿色，你还有一辈子可以去喜欢它。

title: 武书连2022中国大学学科门类排行榜
body:
武书连2022中国大学学科门类排行榜，包括自然科学排行榜、社会科学排行榜，理学、工学、农学、医学、哲学、经济学、法学、教育学、文学、历史学、管理学、艺术学排行榜。

2022中国大学学科门类排行榜，数据全部源于武书连著、中国统计出版社2022年4月出版的《挑大学 选专业--2022高考志愿填报指南》。共计801所公办本科大学。

武书连2022学科门类排行榜等级标准

 
 

 
 

**一、中国大学自然科学排名**

自然科学是理学、工学、农学、医学4个学科的统称，也就是每年高考中的理科。自然科学（理科）的研究对象是物质本身。自然科学排名，体现了各大学自然科学4个学科的综合实力。因此，仅在自然科学某一个学科领先的大学，并不意味着一定能在整个自然科学排名中领先。为了既反映各大学自然科学的综合实力，又反映各大学理学、工学、农学、医学各自的实力，本节将各大学自然科学排名和理学、工学、农学、医学各自的排名一一列出，供报考理科的考生参考。

据国务院学位办公室2019年发表的统计数据，我国当年毕业的自然科学学士占学士总数的47.78%，自然科学硕士占硕士总数的56.49%，自然科学博士占博士总数的79.10%。

801所公办本科大学，共开设自然科学（理科）61个专业类、403个本科目录内专业。设立自然科学本科专业的大学共777所。

武书连2022中国大学自然科学排名

 
 

 

 

（一）中国大学理学排名

理学包括数学、物理学、化学、天文学、地理科学、大气科学、海洋科学、地球物理学、地质学、生物科学、心理学、统计学等12个专业类，共有45个目录内本科专业。

据国务院学位办公室2019年发表的统计数据，我国当年毕业的理学学士占学士总数的6.53%，理学士占硕士总数的7.57%，理学博士占博士总数的21.67%。

801所公办本科大学中，开设理学专业的大学共701所。

武书连2022中国大学理学排名

 
  
 

 

（二）中国大学工学排名

工学包括力学、机械、仪器、材料、能源动力、电气、电子信息、自动化、计算机、土木、水利、测绘、化工与制药、地质、矿业、纺织、轻工、交通运输、海洋工程、航空航天、兵器、核工程、农业工程、林业工程、环境科学与工程、生物医学工程、食品科学与工程、建筑、安全科学与工程、生物工程、公安技术等31个专业类，共有253个目录内本科专业。

据国务院学位办公室2019年发表的统计数据，我国当年毕业的工学学士占学士总数的32.68%，工学硕士占硕士总数的33.65%，工学博士占博士总数的37.37%。

801所公办本科大学中，开设工学专业的大学共763所。

武书连2022中国大学工学排名

 
 

 

（三）中国大学农学排名

农学包括植物生产、自然保护与环境生态、动物生产、动物医学、林学、水产、草学等7个专业类，共有46个目录内本科专业。

据国务院学位办公室2019年发表的统计数据，我国当年毕业的农学学士占学士总数的1.71%，农学硕士占硕士总数的4.05%，农学博士占博士总数的4.61%。

801所公办本科大学中，开设农学专业的大学共254所。

武书连2022中国大学农学排名

 
  
 

 

（四）中国大学医学排名

医学包括基础医学、临床医学、口腔医学、公共卫生与预防医学、中医学、中西医结合、药学、中药学、法医学、医学技术、护理学等11个专业类，共有59个目录内本科专业。

据国务院学位办公室2019年发表的统计数据，我国当年毕业的医学学士占学士总数的6.74%，医学硕士占硕士总数的11.21%，医学博士占博士总数的15.45%。

801所公办本科大学中，开设医学专业的大学共333所。

武书连2022中国大学医学排名

 

 
 

第二节中国大学社会科学排名

社会科学是哲学、经济学、法学、教育学、文学、历史学、管理学、艺术学等8个学科的统称，也就是每年高考中的文科。社会科学（文科）的研究对象是人类社会。社会科学排名，体现了各大学人文社会科学8个学科的综合实力。因此，仅在社会科学某一两个学科领先的大学，并不意味着在整个社会科学排名中一定领先。为了既反映各大学社会科学的综合实力，又展示各大学社会科学每个学科各自的实力，本节将各大学社会科学排名和哲学、经济学、法学、教育学、文学、历史学、管理学、艺术学各自的排名一一列出，供报考文科的考生参考。

与自然科学相比，社会科学高层次毕业人数较少。根据国务院学位办公室2019年发表的统计数据，我国当年毕业的文科学士占学士总数的52.22%，文科硕士占硕士总数的43.50%，文科博士占博士总数的20.86%。

801所公办本科大学，共开设社会科学（文科）31个专业类、329个本科目录内专业。

设立社会科学本科专业的大学共798所。

武书连2022中国大学社会科学排名

 

 
  
 

（一）中国大学哲学排名

哲学只有哲学1个专业类，4个本科专业。

据国务院学位办公室2019年发表的统计数据，我国当年毕业的哲学学士占学士总数的0.05%，哲学硕士占硕士总数的0.56%，哲学博士占博士总数的1.04%。

801所公办本科大学中，开设哲学专业的大学共80所。

武书连2022中国大学哲学排名

 
  
 

 
 

 

（二）中国大学经济学排名

经济学包括经济学、财政学、金融学、经济与贸易4个专业类，25个目录内本科专业。

据国务院学位办公室2019年发表的统计数据，我国当年毕业的经济学学士占学士总数的5.96%，经济学硕士占硕士总数的5.12%，经济学博士占博士总数的3.29%。

设经济学专业的大学共650所。

武书连2022中国大学经济学排名

 

 
 

（三）中国大学法学排名

法学包括法学、政治学、社会学、民族学、马克思主义理论、公安学等6个专业类，共有30个目录内本科专业。

据国务院学位办公室2019年发表的统计数据，我国当年毕业的法学学士占学士总数的3.59%，法学硕士占硕士总数的6.90%，法学博士占博士总数的4.36%。

801所公办本科大学中，开设法学专业的大学共608所。

武书连2022中国大学法学排名

 
  
 

 

（四）中国大学教育学排名

教育学包括教育学、体育学等2个专业类，共有26个目录内本科专业。

据国务院学位办公室2019年发表的统计数据，我国当年毕业的教育学学士占学士总数的3.85%，教育学硕士占硕士总数的6.78%，教育学博士占博士总数的1.66%。

801所公办本科大学中，开设教育学专业的大学共460所。

武书连2022中国大学教育学排名

 

 
 

（五）中国大学文学排名

文学包括中国语言文学、外国语言文学、新闻传播学等3个专业类，共有115个目录内本科专业。

据国务院学位办公室2019年发表的统计数据，我国当年毕业的文学学士占学士总数的9.35%，文学硕士占硕士总数的5.44%，文学博士占博士总数的3.17%。

title: MetaStreet Closed Alpha Launch
body:
We are excited to announce today the closed alpha launch of the [MetaStreet Collateral Vault](https://metastreet.xyz/), the first liquidity scaling solution for NFT credit markets by MetaStreet. The first vaults to be released will be the Avatar-DAI vault. Participation will be limited to Level 4 community members (Officers), and first vault will be capped at 200,000 DAI with a *maximum of 5,000 DAI* deposit limit per wallet. The goal is to get maximum distribution to our earliest community members, broaden our testing environment, and create a starting point where we can experiment and grow.

**Quests:** Over the next 3 days, we have a few challenges for our mainnet alpha launch- there may be some goodies for those who complete any of the tasks below:

* **Difficult:** Sell a qualifying promissory note to the Vault (go to NFTfi and get a *qualifying* promissory note, sell to MetaStreet)
* **Moderate:** Deposit 5,000 DAI into the Senior tranche only (100% Senior).
* **Easy:** Deposit 3,000 DAI in any combination (Senior/Junior).

**What is a MetaStreet Collateral Vault?**

MetaStreet is a liquidity scaling protocol for NFT credit markets. MetaStreet's primary product is a vault that enables secondary market liquidity for NFT-backed notes. Participants can deposit capital in order to earn yield from diversified portfolios of NFT-backed notes. Simultaneously, owners of NFT-backed notes can sell their notes into the vaults, earning a spread and allowing for capital recycling while providing the vaults with the yield that attracts the capital deposits in the first place.

**How do I interact with the Vault?**

The easiest way to interact with the vault is via *Deposit Capital*. Simply enter the amount of DAI you want to deposit (current maximum of 5,000 DAI per user), select a ratio of Senior/Junior, and then deposit!

> *Important Note:* After depositing, your capital will be used to acquire promissory notes through the vault. It may take \~30-90 days to redeem your capital depending on when notes are originated and the overall vault utilization.

The most sophisticated way to engage with the platform is to go to [nftfi.com](http://nftfi.com) and originate a promissory note against a BAYC or CryptoPunk that meets the MetaStreet requirements (confirm first by using the Note Calculator). Afterwards, you can head over to *Sell Note* and you can get your money back (plus profits!) depending on the note you originated and how much money is available in the vaults. A great place for those arbitrageur types!

**How does MetaStreet permissionlessly price NFT-backed notes?**

Check out our “Home” page to see what the MetaStreet terms are today, and test it live via our Note Calculator!

In order to offer real-time, dynamic pricing, MetaStreet utilizes an in-house price oracle for collateral values, with a weighted-average discount rate to capture both note and vault characteristics at any time. Maximum LTVs and durations are set at the protocol level and subject to approval by the DAO. The oracle itself references the lesser of current floor price and trailing 30-day volume weighted average floor price.

As of **May 31, 12pm EST**, the key terms for each asset type are:

* CryptoPunks
  * Collateral Value: $93,000
  * Max Duration: 90 days
  * Max LTV: 40%
* Bored Ape Yacht Club
  * Collateral Value: $152,000
  * Max Duration: 90 days
  * Max LTV: 40%

Interest rates are dynamic based on these parameters and vault utilization levels, resulting in a singular discount rate that prices each individual note.

**Which NFT types will be included in these first two vaults?**

The Avatar Vaults (first DAI, later ETH) will initially be approved for CryptoPunks and BAYC as collateral. Future additions to the vaults will be subject to a governance process. In addition to the Avatar Vaults, future vaults will cover other NFT types (ie, Artwork, financial NFTs, DAO vouchers, etc).

**How do I gain access to the closed beta?**

The closed beta is restricted from US persons and citizens from other restricted countries, and is also limited to community members that have completed the first 4 levels of [Tradeweaver](https://metastreet.xyz/tradeweaver) (powered by Otterspace), MetaStreet’s community onboarding tool. You can also ask an Officer (L4) for the constantly changing password as well - but they don’t have to share it if they don’t want to!

**How do I become a member of the Private DAO?**

Currently, Private DAO membership is limited to accredited investors that have provided seed capital for the protocol and team. In the future, the Private DAO will transition into a Public DAO format.

**Where can I learn more about the protocol?**

Check out our [Gitbook](https://metastreet.gitbook.io/metastreet/) to learn more, and join our [Discord](http://discord.gg/metastreet) community for any questions!

title: Announcing Tsunami Testnet (and Airdrop)
body:
We’d like to announce that Tsunami testnet is up and running. We invite everyone to test Tsunami with us, and participate in airdrop. 1% of all TSN supply will be distributed between testnet participants.

To become eligible for airdrop, you need to at least successfully apply for testnet participation, and use most of the Tsunami features (long buy, short sell, use leverage). The more you contribute to the project and community - the bigger your share in airdrop become. We will especially reward participants who:

* achieve the highest trading profit
* report bugs
* helps new members in community by answering questions

After registration, valid participants will receive 1000 testnet USDN on their account. Note, that those are not real USDN, and are worthless outside testnet. Your goal will be to achieve the highest trading profit per day.

To participate in testnet register using the link: <https://gleam.io/gUJsq/whitelist-tsunami>. 

You will need to:

* subscribe to our twitter
* retweet testnet invitation
* provide valid telegram username
* subscribe to our telegram channel & group
* provide Waves testnet address

How to get Waves testnet address:

1. Open your Keeper Wallet
2. In the lower left, change Mainnet to Testnet
3. Click on Copy Address in upper right
4. Done, you testnet address is in clipboard, paste it to registration form

**For Waves.Exchange users:**

1. Open Waves.Exchange testnet using the link: <https://testnet.waves.exchange/> 
2. Log-in or register using your preferred method (seed or email)
3. Copy Address from upper right corner

Testnet is going live 01.06

title: 赫尔松州军民政府：计划于近期加入俄罗斯联邦
body:
5月31日，据塔斯社报道，赫尔松州军民政府表示，该地区计划于近期加入俄罗斯联邦，并成为其一个联邦主体。（总台记者 张誉耀）

　　**相关报道：**　

　　**俄占赫尔松地区长官称希望并入俄国，克宫回应：必须如克里米亚一样合法（观察者网）**

　　\[文/观察者网 齐倩\]位于乌克兰东南部的赫尔松地区目前完全处于俄罗斯军方的控制之下。赫尔松当地高级官员5月11日称，赫尔松地区政府计划请求普京允许该地区加入俄罗斯。

　　俄罗斯总统府克里姆林宫发言人佩斯科夫同日回应称，赫尔松地区是否会成为俄罗斯的一部分，应由其居民决定。他补充说，做出这样的决定必须要有明确的法律基础，“应绝对合法，就如克里米亚一样”。

俄新社报道截图

　　据俄新社（RIA Novosti）报道，赫尔松地区军民署副主席斯特雷穆索夫（Kirill Stremousov）11日表示，当地政府将向俄罗斯总统普京提出请求，将该地区纳入俄罗斯。

　　“赫尔松市属于俄罗斯，而不是将在赫尔松地区成立赫尔松人民共和国，也不会有全民公决，”斯特雷穆索夫称，“这将是一个单一法令，基于赫尔松地区领导人对俄罗斯联邦的呼吁，请求将该地区纳入俄罗斯联邦的正式领土”。

　　据斯特雷穆索夫透露，到今年年底，赫尔松地区将完全转向俄罗斯立法。此外，到5月底，该地区将开始运营一家卢布兑换银行，未来将并入俄罗斯银行体系。

　　对此，克里姆林宫发言人佩斯科夫表示，赫尔松地区是否会成为俄罗斯的一部分，应由其居民决定。

　　佩斯科夫回应称，首先，赫尔松地区居民应自己决定自己的命运；其次，这个问题应该由法律专家进行清楚、仔细的核实和评估。他说：“做出这样的决定必须要有明确的法律基础，应绝对合法，就像当初的克里米亚（加入俄罗斯）一样。”

赫尔松地区位于乌克兰东南部，现处于俄军控制之下

　　俄罗斯国防部3月15日宣布，乌克兰赫尔松州已完全处于俄罗斯军方的控制之下。该州首府赫尔松市是俄军占领的第一个乌克兰大城市。赫尔松市是一座位于乌克兰东南部的港口城市，约有29万人口。

　　3月30日，乌克兰武装部队总参谋部发布声明称，俄罗斯正计划在占领的乌克兰领土上组建政治机构，并为此在俄罗斯境内遴选执法机构、检察官和法院的官员。赫尔松市两名政府官员4月表示，俄军已控制赫尔松市议会大楼。

　　乌克兰总统泽连斯基4月21日指责俄罗斯计划在南部赫尔松和扎波罗热地区“伪造”独立公投。他还警告俄罗斯，任何“吞并”企图都将招致制裁，将导致俄罗斯像1917年内战后一样贫穷。

　　与此同时，乌克兰军方多次指控俄罗斯计划在赫尔松地区举行公投。这一消息并未得到俄罗斯方面证实。

　　不过，俄罗斯国家杜马议员、执政党总委员会秘书图尔恰克（Andrei Turchak）5月7日表示，俄罗斯永远来到了赫尔松地区，这里的居民将决定该地区的地位。赫尔松州行政负责人萨尔多（Vladimir Saldo）此前也说，该地区已经是俄罗斯联邦这个大家庭的一员。

　　赫尔松是近期第二个申请加入俄罗斯的地区。3月30日，南奥塞梯地区领导人称将在近期做出法律行动，以寻求加入俄罗斯联邦。俄罗斯联邦委员会维护国家主权委员会主席表示，在南奥塞梯民众通过公投表达意愿后，启动南奥塞梯加入俄联邦的程序没有法律障碍。

　　**更多报道：**

　　**赫尔松当局拒绝承认泽连斯基：他是西方主子的人质（观察者网）**

　　\[编译/观察者网 李焕宇\]“泽连斯基不是乌克兰总统，他是西方主子的人质！”

　　据俄新社5月31日报道，赫尔松地区军民署副主席斯特雷穆索夫（Kirill Stremousov）表示，他们拒绝将泽连斯基视为乌克兰总统。

　　斯特雷穆索夫称：“乌克兰人民被纳粹高官挟持为人质，正处在乌克兰安全局的盖世太保恐怖统治之下。泽连斯基无法表明他自己作为乌克兰总统的立场，他也不是乌克兰总统，而是被西方主子挟持的人质。泽伦斯基和整个基辅团队都是外国资助的，在乌克兰，他们重建了类似纳粹德国一样的存在。”

　　“泽伦斯基被证明跟波罗申科一脉相承，但他的情况要更糟。”斯特雷穆索夫如此强调。

　　赫尔松地区位于乌克兰东南部，其首府赫尔松市是俄军控制的第一个乌克兰大城市，约有29万人口，是一座港口城市。

　　5月11日，特雷穆索夫曾表示当地政府将向俄罗斯总统普京提出请求，将该地区纳入俄罗斯，这让赫尔松成为南奥塞梯外近期第二个申请加入俄罗斯的地区。

　　“赫尔松市属于俄罗斯，而不是将在赫尔松地区成立赫尔松人民共和国，也不会有全民公决，”斯特雷穆索夫称，“这将是一个单一法令，基于赫尔松地区领导人对俄罗斯联邦的呼吁，请求将该地区纳入俄罗斯联邦的正式领土”。

　　对此，克里姆林宫发言人佩斯科夫表示，赫尔松地区是否会成为俄罗斯的一部分，应由其居民决定。

　　佩斯科夫回应称，首先，赫尔松地区居民应自己决定自己的命运；其次，这个问题应该由法律专家进行清楚、仔细的核实和评估。他说：“做出这样的决定必须要有明确的法律基础，应绝对合法，就像当初的克里米亚（加入俄罗斯）一样。”

　　5月25日，俄罗斯总统普京签署了一项关于简化乌克兰扎波罗热州和赫尔松州两地居民获得俄罗斯公民身份程序的法令；5月30日，俄罗斯卢布已在该地区正式全面流通，根据规定，该地区内的所有商业场所必须同时接受用俄罗斯卢布和乌克兰格里夫纳进行交易；除此之外，斯特雷穆索夫称他们已经开始向俄罗斯出售去年收获粮食，并努力向当地和俄罗斯加工厂供应葵花籽。

　　另据《华盛顿邮报》5月31日报道，乌克兰军方称他们已经开始在该国南部对俄罗斯军队发起反攻，并称在赫尔松方向取得了重大进展。

title: 以色列外长：正推进与沙特关系正常化
body:
以色列外交部长亚伊尔·拉皮德5月30日接受以军方电台采访时证实，以色列正与美国和相关海湾国家沟通协调与沙特阿拉伯实现关系正常化事宜。

　　“我们相信与沙特推进关系正常化进程是可能的，这符合我们的利益。”拉皮德强调保障两国安全利益的重要性，并表示将分步推进这一漫长进程。

　　在美国政府推动下，阿联酋、巴林、苏丹、摩洛哥近年相继同以色列实现关系正常化。此前，阿拉伯国家中仅埃及、约旦同以色列建交。

title: Cognitive Bias
body:
```
Cognitive biases are mental short-cuts and some of the most 
mind-boggling phenomena in psychology. Their nature is one of the reasons why each one of us is stuck in his/her own reality.

Knowing your biases could help you get unstuck and make better decisions.

Let's dive in! 🤿
```

![The More You Know](https://media.giphy.com/media/3ohzdLQUbKEu47o9Ww/giphy.gif)

Biases can stem from the brain's preference for lower energy expenditure, missing information and evolutionary pressures. While they enable quick decisions, they also introduce a flurry of errors, clouding our judgement.

![Cognitive Bias Codex by designhacks.co](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GwX8JdI_atAa7av3ZmibR.png?height=1570&width=1964)

### 1. Dunning-Kruger effect

You may underestimate your expertise in a field you naturally excel at because you think anyone must be good at it, or overestimate your knowledge when in fact you know little about a subject. 

Antidote: Ask your peers about your superpower.

![Donald knows everything.](https://media.giphy.com/media/l46CyR1pEr1zN5Dxu/giphy.gif)

### 2. Confirmation bias

We tend to value information confirming our own beliefs more than information contradicting them. It takes conscious effort to take new evidence into consideration and to tolerate the uneasy feeling of cognitive dissonance.

![Confirmation Bias](https://media.giphy.com/media/eEjf3t9MeTXZM0d91u/giphy.gif)

### 3. Gambler's fallacy

Let's say a gambler plays coin flipping – he sees “heads” 9 times in a row and decides “tails” is long overdue. He goes all in. 

Unfortunately, the odds did not change based on past results. They are statistically independent.

Heads!

![Gene Hackman flipping a coin](https://media.giphy.com/media/FfrlRYkqKY1lC/giphy.gif)

### 4. Barnum effect

What do psychics and salesmen have in common? 

They employ statements vague enough to trick you into believing they are specifically tailored to you.

Example:

> “At times you have serious doubts whether you have made the right decision or done the right thing.”

![I see great things in your future…](https://media.giphy.com/media/dw2yCF4MhcNmSMgpfe/giphy.gif)

### 5. The sunk cost fallacy

You buy a used car. 

A week later, it breaks down. You pay the repair shop to fix it. Days later, you need to get the brakes fixed. And a door. The repairs cost you more than the car.

You know you should sell it at a loss, but you keep throwing cash at it.

![Well, sh\*\*!](https://media.giphy.com/media/QWFJANl1sgEid0dbRY/giphy.gif)

### 6. Halo effect

I make my friends mad each time I shrug off [@elonmusk](https://twitter.com/elonmusk)'s bad decisions and Ambien-fueled tweets because I admire his ingenuity and First Principles thinking in [@lexfridman](https://twitter.com/lexfridman)'s podcasts.

Maybe I'm just prone to the halo effect?

![Elon Musk on Joe Rogan's Podcast](https://media.giphy.com/media/5eFRL3jPLgbNj6iwPx/giphy.gif)

### 7. Planning fallacy

I totally underestimated the time it would take to create this thread, though it was a rewarding experience. 

It turns out I'm in good company: Scientists found out most humans are way too optimistic when it comes to setting realistic deadlines for tasks.

![It's getting late.](https://media.giphy.com/media/QumnfihD4ibhRUqGcH/giphy.gif)

Sources and further reading:

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cognitive_bias](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cognitive_bias)

[https://thedecisionlab.com/biases](https://thedecisionlab.com/biases)

[https://answerthepublic.com/reports/4c0a8384-e3bd-4648-81aa-194e1d49dee6](https://answerthepublic.com/reports/4c0a8384-e3bd-4648-81aa-194e1d49dee6)

title: Solidity 课程 10: 继承
Symphony Finance订单簿链上收益协议
body:
Symphony Finance是基于Polygon网络的首个收益限价单DEFI协议。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2TnrONtsSCxqEVbTbO4Y5.png?height=824&width=1897)

Symphony Finance支持用户在平台创建限价单。该协议创建了一个收益生成协议，在我们挂限价单资产未成交时，资产会存入到收益生成协议中产生收益。

举个例子，当前matic价格是0.65USDC，若Bob想在matic价格为0.6USDC时购买1000个matic，则可以在平台中创建matic价格为0.6USDC时购买1000个matic，在matic价格跌至0.6USDC代币成交之前，协议会将USDC存入到收益生成协议中产生收益。

同理，如果Bob想在matic价格为0.7刀时出售手上的1000个matic，则可以创建当matic价格为0.7USDC时出售1000个matic，而在matic涨至0.7USDC之前，协议会将matic存入到收益生成协议中产生收益。

Symphony Finance如此创新的做法极大提高了资金的利用效率，允许用户在限价订单在订单簿上的时间内赚取收益。

Symphony Finance目前尚未发行代币，有需求的用户可以体验一下协议的交互，还可以博取一下未来的空投。

接下来我们以polygon网络为例，开始我们的交互教程。

准备、首先准备下小狐狸钱包，配置下小狐狸钱包的polygon网络配置

* **网络名称**：Polygon Mainnet
* **官网**：<https://polygon.technology/>
* **ChainID**：137
* **NetworkID**：137
* **符号**：Polygon

如下图选择Polygon网络，点击Connect Wallet链接钱包

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3xwkEdwX_3RhzBWA9Zb5W.png?height=815&width=1905)

一、我们以出售限价0.7出售50个matic换取34.88USDC为例，选择待出售的资产的数量，限价单的价格，点击Place Limit Order 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NEh-WpeI3jEd5jvqXQFct.png?height=813&width=1905)

随后在确认页面选择Confirm，在跳出来的小狐狸钱包中选择确认授权

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wH2hdxottwJPGBlK3Njk5.png?height=826&width=1889)

订单创建好后会在Open Order中显示。

在matic价格跌至0.6USDC之前，协议会将USDC存入到收益生成协议中产生收益。

当matic价格跌至0.6USDC后，协议将自动成交我们的限价单。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yOyFuTNXvtORwwSGAvYNb.png?height=813&width=1890)

如果策略有变化，协议也允许用户取消订单或者修改订单。只需点击Cancel取消，或者点击Modify修改即可

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SXQrdok1ZpCWwUkTdb9_-.png?height=743&width=1682)

二、当前市价是1个USDC可以换取1.48个matic，我们决定在1个USDC可以换取1.5个matic时出售50个USDC换取matic，

选择出售的资产和数量，限价订单价格，点击Place Limit Order 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/oI2K_7x4rxDRSG_COVivd.png?height=824&width=1901)

随后在确认页面选择Confirm，在跳出来的小狐狸钱包中选择确认授权

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qMJ__mUHt1T9lppleVFJ1.png?height=815&width=1882)

订单创建好后会在Open Order中显示。

在1个USDC可以换取1.5个matic之前，协议会将matic存入到收益生成协议中产生收益。

当1个USDC可以换取1.5个matic后，协议将自动成交我们的限价单。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QFuaP6L5d5MnekxmKeSfq.png?height=816&width=1876)

Symphony Finance限价单收益聚合器的创新极大提高了资金的利用效率，尤其特别适合做网格交易的朋友，对大户也很友好，有需求的用户可以多多尝试下。

个人建议，交互至少3笔以上，金额超过1000刀。
